Looks : It looks premium, like apple clone - 7/5  The most I liked was the look of this keyboard2. Build Quality : Decent for the price point - 4/5  Plastic build and keys are little loose, but still quite strong3. Key Press : Very soft hit, and comfortable - 4/5  At beginning I felt little uncomfortable since I was using another keyboard, after using this 2 weeks I started feeling comfortable.4.  Customer Support - 5/5  I returned my first keyboard which I thought was faulty, but it was not, and they arranged the replacement.  Actually I got confused with the numeric pallet implemented on the usual keys.Tips : Don't forget to disable the "Num Lock" before using this or else you may also repeat my mistake.I hope this will help other customers.Good Luck :)

This is advertised as a 26 key anti-ghosting keyboard which implies that it can register 26 unique keypresses together/simultaneously,which is a pretty important feature  for gaming for obvious reasons.However the keyboard has an issue with anti ghosting, when you press and hold 'W' and 'Left Shift' key, and then try to press 'H' together,the 'H' key press doesn't register.Which is pretty obnoxious cos I've my flash bound to 'H' in CS:GO, so in the scenario where you are shift-walking and want to switch to flash by pressing 'H' while keeping to walk,it won't work.Now I thought it was a problem with the particular piece so I put up a replacement request. But to my surprise the second one had the same exact problem which have now led me to believe it is a design fault.I couldn't find out if the problem came up with other key combinations or not but it is a pretty serious problem for a keyboard advertised as "gaming keyboard"Other cons:1.the key height is obnoxiously  high making the actuation point so deep that you literally have to press like 1 cm deep to get it to actuate2. the spacing between the keys are too big but that's subjective so you know just saying...Pros:1.the rgb is adequate for the price can you get more bang for your buck in this price range?YES but you know...

I don't normally write reviews unless I really hate a product or love it. This is the latter. I wanted an external keyboard for my laptop for some casual gaming. I wasn't expecting much looking at the price but was pleasantly surprised. Here are the pros and cons:Pros:‚Ä¢ Looks great (even better than it does in pictures)‚Ä¢ Good for casual gaming (cannot comment on eSports)‚Ä¢ Great value for money (compared to the competition- Redragon, Redgear etc in this price range )Cons:‚Ä¢ The letters aren't legible without the backlight (which doesn't matter, as you shouldn't be buying a backlit keyboard if you want to turn off the backlight)‚Ä¢ The space bar is slightly angled towards the front which makes it uncomfortable to use (Easy fix is to use some form of a wrist rest to raise your hand to match the height of the space bar.‚Ä¢ The colour scheme cannot be changed. I initially thought we could change it to a single color but that is not possible. The colour scheme you see in the pictures is what you get. However it does look a lot better in real life. You can change the brightness of the backlight and also change the modes (between beating and breathing) which is pretty good but I prefer the default setting.Note:I don't type too much so I cannot comment on that. For what little I've typed on this keyboard, it's pretty comfortable.I've never used a mechanical keyboard so I can't compare this to one.If you're looking for something that looks good and can be used for casual gaming, look no further.

You can't change the light color. You can however change the lighting mode and brightness. The key press travel is enough for typing enthusiasts. The key face is smaller than expected and mis types happen, but when you get used to it in an hour or so, your hand tends to glide right. I have huge hands. Love the typing experience overall, lighting quality is amazing, but I would've liked a single color option too. Rainbow is a bit too loud for my taste. The key board is quite raised, you may need a wrist support for smaller hands. For gaming it is quite good. Cable is long enough to reach my CPU below the desk.

Now as many others said earlier that this is not a mechanical keyboard, its true, its semi-mechanical. Its tactile feel is good through, with decent enough feedback and still gives that click mechanical sound, even though its not up to that level of performance. I mean come on, Mechanical Keys are the best and you pay for it. But for those who are not into mechanical keyboards but still want its performance to certain extent while gaming, this is a good solution. And for those who say this is not good for gaming, well its their opinion. For me its more than just being decent and I have no complaints on its performance. On the build quality side, there is nothing left to desire much, but its definitely neither too heavy nor too light.

I got it @1099 so can't complain about Price. But if you want quality this is not one. It's a regular keyboard with backlight. I received it without proper packaging, so it was broken. Now Let's talk about the keyboardPros: Backlit, changeable keys, good placement of the keys.Cons: Built quality, elevation stand won't tilt the device, it only levels the keyboard. Keyboard is tilted towards front, which is totally design fault. Key strokes are silent as hell, feels almost like touchpad.Now let's talk about Mouse...Pros: feels great, (though it's made of low grade plastic). Have changeable DPI settings, which is somewhat helpful in FPS gaming. Light weight.Cons: Poor built quality, colour changes with DPI only. In low DPI mouse movement is not smooth.Extremely doubtful about the longevity of the product. Pls improve packaging and the built quality.

A fantastic combo. The second I saw this I instantly bought it. There is not other deal better than this, at this price.The keyboard feels sturdy and tough. It doesn't seem cheaply made at all and has a very soft touch to it. I like that, but people who prefer a more clicky keyboard won't like that. The backlighting is great, however, don't expect it to be something that you can use to see the keys at night. The keys are not made to let the light pass through but rather they're solid keys with no light going through. The features are well explained in the manual and they're working just the way they're supposed to. The 19 key anti ghosting is like icing on the cake.Now for the mouse. It's perfect. No better way to describe it. Has six buttons in total and multiple DPI settings. The appearance is gorgeous and really pops out and makes you just sit back and look. It has a breathing effect which can also be applied to the keyboard (Read the manual). The optical accuracy is great for any kind of work.All in all, don't go for anything else unless you're planning on spending more. Buy this if you have a tight budget. Excellent build quality, aesthetics, and durability.

I was searching for a keyboard for regular use, but with back light so that I can work in dark too.All the keyboard and mouse sets are above 2000 which was not my budget. But Cosmic Byte resolved my issue.Key board is amazing. I can work in dark too, but in low light Red color is great to work. Mouse is amazing too. You can easily change the light in keyboard or mouse. Yes it doesn't give rainbow colors but my requirement was to work in dark & this set fulfilled my demand. Keys are very soft. I was using Dell keyboard and these keys are more soft than the dell.Few tips to the company:please add the option to turn off mouse light too. Plus change the font used for Num lock and Caps lock light. Keyboard is amazing but whenever i see that font, i feel the cheap side.Everything else is amazing.

BEFORE BUYING THIS PRODUCT PLZ READ THIS ONCE:  This was the first gaming keyboard i bought in amazon.It had both good and bad things which u should check as soon as u receive this and claim for replacement just in case.1.The description shows that it has adjustable light brightness, even manual says that, but trust me only the corona edition of cosmic byte keyboard has this brightness adjustment, ofcourse the breathing effect works fine.2.It seems to have multimedia keys which can be accessed by pressing FN key+function keys.but this works only on windows 10 and not on windows 7.i havent used in linux but this one is not recommended for linux users.3.In my case me and my friend ordered this same keyboard ,both of us had one common issue, WHENEVER LEFT SHIFT IS PRESSED CTRL KEY ALSO GETS PRESSED SINCE SHIFT KEY IS QUITE BULGED AND FORCES CTRL ALSO TO PRESS. if u buy this ,check this one first, I claimed for replacement .ALL THE KEYS APART THAT WAS QUITE GOOD AND REPLACED ONE DIDNT HAVE THAT PROBLEM.4.Mouse has 4 prebiult dpi settings (800,1200,1600,2400),you can just switch to them with the dpi button next to scroll wheel.5.lights look pretty good when viewed from top angle ,but quite dim when placed while typing and least visible in some keys.6.All keys are quite sturdy and a good quality material ,only thing is all application key in normal keyboard next to the right CTRl is replaced by light button.7.MOUSE HAS MORE COLOURS WHICH CHANGES AUTOMATICALLY AND TRUST ME MOUSE IS AWESOME.8.OVERALL QUALITY AND LOOK OF THE KEYBOARD IS NICE AND MY MARK WOULD BE (7.5/10).GOOD TO BUY THIS ONE FOR BUDGET GAMING PC.9.INCASE IF U FEEL ANY PROBLEM RELACE IT IMMMEDIATELY.

Just bought this product and my review is :At this price range this product is more that you can expect . I have bought this in Feb 2018. So, it's a long term review. Things I've noticed so far are the keys have a lot of travel than a normal mechanical keyboard, backlighting has only 2 modes: Normal and breathing effects. Well designed for gaming and durability is really good as body of the keyboard is made of metal. Keyboard keeps my palm cool even after using it for hours. The only cons I've come across are color damage on keys and metal parts, dust accumulation under keys, but you can clean them easily. Overall, I'm much satisfied with this product and would suggest it as best value for money gaming keyboard.

The build quality of the keyboard is fine as it has a metal plate on the top so there is minimal or no deck flex. The lighting is fine. The colors can't be changed but the brightness can be increased or decreased and there is also a breathing effect. For the people who want these qualities it's a good keyboard. BUT...... if you want literally anything else the one I got was not at all good. The keys are very mushy and it does not feel good to type on. The actuation force on the keys are uneven, it takes a lot of force to start pressing the key but the rest of the key's travel requires no force at all which is very annoying if you type a lot or game. Then there is the spacebar, Oh.. The Spacebar...it's just bad. The spacebar is so heavy that it requires no activation force to press and the key struggles to bring it up. The spacebar bounces back if you slam it but if press it gently like normal people it gets stuck to the chassis of the keyboard. This is VERY annoying if you use the keyboard at all because the spacebar gets stuck and you have to pull it up to use it again (this issue of the spacebar getting stuck maybe exclusive to my particular unit, but however the actuation force is non-existent on the spacebar). So consider whether the spacebar issue is important for before you buy this product, I game a lot and use the spacebar very much so it is an instant deal-breaker for me, and if you game I suggest you stay away from this keyboard. But if you are buying it for casual use go for it.

It is a good keyboard except one issue - The spacebar key. It requires 3 times force to press it compared to other keys when you press it at the ends of the spacebar. If you press it at the center, it works fine, but I press it at the ends with my thumb, thus it becomes impossible to type because for every space, I would have to press with three times the force, thus destroying the flow of the typing. Due to this one flaw, I had to return it as it made it unusable to me.Another minor issue is the big cosmic byte logo right above the arrow keys. You would think it is something written on the keyboard, but no, it is a plastic component with height same as a pressed key. This makes it annoying when you press the up arrow key and it hits your fingers. Please don't put such huge logos on an otherwise good keyboard.The keyboard build quality is excellent. It is metal, and keys have a nice feel to it. The lighting is also excellent. I don't know why they made these two issues with otherwise a very good keyboard. I bought it because my friend had a two year old cosmicbyte keyboard which was excellent and had none of these issues, and that was the only reason I choce a cosmicbyte keyboard, and now they have these issues...

Shipped early and packed well.Small sizeEasy to connect (worked on windows, Linux and Android phone (Mi Note4) without any problems)Keys are very responsive and have a nice rubberised feel.Rechargeable batteryBacklight works and love the colours (more than 3 since RGB combinations are possible)Indicator lights to notify about Charing, RF status and connection status.Many possible uses with multifunctional buttons.ConsMouse trackpad is a bit small but sensitivity settings can compensate for thatBack plastic seems very very cheapBattery seems to be very small capacity (will update about battery life after 1 month)

I was looking for a portable keyboard for using with my laptop and smart TV. while researching i came across this product, ordered it to try and boy i was surprised with the functionalities and its features.1. It has backlighting which is very good to be used in dark. also its RGB mode is awesome, my son loved the lighting on the keyboard2. can be used with laptop, PC and Smart TV. I tried with all and really made a difference in searching for titles on Netflix and Prime from earlier when i had to painfully scroll through each letter individually3. the buttons are good enough for daily usage and provide feedback when pressed, for me it was really comfortable4. Battery life is good enough- on one charge it ran for 3 days with intermittent usage where i used it as a keyboard for my laptop too.5. wireless- this is the best, its very portable, fits in my palm, can be used handheld and is wireless. Just plug in its receiver and you are good to go. you can type from couch, i tested till a distance of 10 ft from my tv and it was working fine6. Sleep mode- this is best as it conserves battery very well. As soon as the keyboard is not in use for about 10 seconds, it goes to sleep conserving battery, and when you need it again,  just pick it up and start typing and it will start working again. Really well thought out feature.All in all its a complete package if you want a portable handheld keyboard for your daily usage. Just keep in mind that its not a gamepad for playing games, buy a separate gamepad for it

Very useful and high quality material. I believe everyone who is working for long hours in front of desk should use this as support to you hand ergonomics. Usually without using the cushions and if the keyboard and mouse do not such ergonomic arrangements it will cause the joints pain at the wrists. To avoid that and keep the wrist straight we should have some cushion for both the devices. This product gives me a great relief from that pain and maintains my ergonomics. It's premium made and value for money and highly recommended.

This is such a nice product. I was skeptical choosing the green colour, but it turned out to be even better than the pictures. I am using it with my Macbook Pro and connecting it was seamless. Mac will ask your help to setup this keyboard and once done, you can use it like a normal keyboard. The Windows button on this keyboard will be mapped to the Command key of the mac.In terms of design & aesthetics, it's just stunning. The keystrokes are lovely, there is good enough sound (not too loud) and the overall experience is very good. I type a lot and it doesn't hurt my hands after long typing sessions. You can remove the keys and clean them. It's a beautiful mech keyboard. If you want something different which will not be primarily for gaming, this is your thing. The mouse is good as well, nothing special though.Overall, highly recommend.

I've wanted a fancy mechanical keyboard for so long. This one works just fine. The keys sound amazing. The colors are so pretty in real. The photos couldn't do justice. I actually wanted blue & green versions of this keyboard too but settled on this one cuz they look like yummy candies. Enough about the looks, this actually works pretty well. The mouse is perfectly sized and snug in your hands. It was a bit fast in the start but then I adjusted the settings in my laptop now it works just like how I wanted it to. The keys are a bit closely set together but you'll eventually get used to it. I mean this is my third day and (I write a hell lot of essays) I'm already used to it. I play a decent amount of RPG games too and I love using this keyboard for light gaming. One suggestion I have for the manufacturers is about the indicator lights.  They are placed on the slope of the rounded edge of the keyboard and I can't really sometimes see if the caps lock is on or not. But that's just a minor issue. Really love this product and highly recommend it. If i find anything I don't like about it in the future I will update the review.p.s forgive my lq grainy pics.

This is great entry level mechanical keyboard.This keyboard has blue mechanical switch from Chinese manufacturer not cherry MX but still its nice. it has nice clicky sound. Gamers and typist gonna love it. This is not actual RGB keyboard. It has rainbow lighting you can change lighting Mods but color on every line is fixed like from top to bottom 1-Blue, 2-Red, 3-Orange, 4-Green, 5-Purple, 6-White.i attached video with all lighting mods.and some images this is how keyboard look at night.

The keyboard is amazing for this price point,You know the good part, ill tell you about the bad part of this keyboardI am updating this after 4 month of heavy usage and gaming! (28/11/2019)1-some people might find lack of stabilizer in keys as a issue2-Only top plate is aluminum, BUT KEYBOARD IS STILL 0.98KG3-Jixian switches are soldered to the pcb, but at this price its ok4-Lacks in built memory , so you have to reset lighting again and again once you turn it off.5-Aluminium plate can pick some scratches if not handled carefully6- MOST IMPORTANT the cable being not braided can be issue for some7-The user manual has a lot of mistakes and has wrong features written , i mailed cosmic byte to confirm , they denied any such features mentioned.8- Ok,after usage i realized, that the key puller is real flimsy, please take good care to avoid any such damages.I got this keyboard for under 1900/- so, wait for the right time and buy it at cheaper rates, because if you are willing to spend above 2k rupees, the Zebronics max pro would be a better option.However at this price point. the keyboards build quality is amazing, I am using it right now to type this review!So buy it when you get a good price or buy a combo  if possible.

I've been using this keyboard for past 2 days and typing feels amazing, mechanical keyboard feels great, the soft tactile key presses and feedback is so satisfying. The only problem I faced so far is the lighting pattern. On this keyboard the lighting pattern tends to reset every time when I turn on my PC. It is very annoying and I hope Cosmic Byte does something to fix this problem, and also I don't find any drivers for this keyboard.I bought it for Rs 1745 and for this price i think its a steal.Edit :- I've contacted CB for the above problem and the solution is to keep pressing "FN + ESC" for 10 secs and it works,also their customer service is very helpful and very prompt. 10/10 for overall experience.

Update: I wrote to Cosmic support and they asked for a video to show the problem. I did and they suggested two things which didn't work. They replaced the keyboard with a new one as they stated that the problem was no fixable. This seems to be working fine at this time (received it 10 minutes back). I upgraded my rating to 3 from 1 because they have very good aggressive support and take lot of pain to ensure that the issue is resolved.----Few additional points:- Suddenly the W key stopped working. I had to press very hard for it to work sometimes.Update on 26th November: It has almost completely stopped functioning.  I have enclosed a video showing the issue.- Sometimes this keyboard is garbling output or dropping some keys when I am typing too fast.- Overall this keyboard is not giving me what I expected from a mechanical keyboard.Earlier review (still valid):The single biggest issue is that they used a strange font for keys which is hard to read. The B looks like 13 for instance!I had to look for several seconds just to guess the @ key. There was absolutely no reason for adventurism with key fonts! To add to the misery they used strange words as opposed to sticking to what we are comfortable with and found in 99.9% of the keyboards.Till date, I don't know how to set scroll lock!I don't see much value for rainbow colors or even the multiple disco lighting modes (for lack of a better word) in the keyboard. It serves no purpose and just an annoyance.Use of acronyms like WASD in the documentation is another bummer.The keys could use more brightness.For for the pros, the keyboard is solid and has nice keys.

This is the only mechanical keyboard that is being sold at this price range(1.7k). It is my first mechanical keyboard. If you haven't tried any mechanical keyboard yet & want to buy a mechanical keyboard then at this price this is a steal. I GOT IT FOR Rs.1649 & it was a steal. the keys feel soft but they have a tactile feel when they activate, also responsive, the backlighting is the cherry on top. but one thing is the font used in the keycap i don't like it maybe you do or do not that a personal preference & i'm also being nit-picky about it. Value for money!EDIT: [11/09/19] have been using it about a month & it's still fine. Also i discovered some new stuff pressing fn+1,2,3,4,5,6 changes it to pre configured lighting. try it yourself (not the numpad 123456 tho)EDIT 2: [06/01/2020] HAPPY NEW YEAR if you are reading this.Now this keyboard has been serving me well no issues what so ever!

- If you're a Mac user like me and do a lot of coding/typing then please don't buy this as there is no driver from the vendor and out of the box driver is very flakey.- The media keys are not supported as well on a Mac- Sometimes, some keys don't respond, so you will definitely miss lot of key strokes- No inbuilt memory to remember the rainbow lighting setting so everytime you disconnect everything reset to factory defaultAll in all don't buy this if you use Mac, for linux and Windows for basic testing everything just works (full testing pending yet)

You might think that their is a lot to be happy about just because a mechanical keyboard is cheap,BUT trust me their is NOTHING to be happy about, it's just one of those Chinese products which flash in people's eyes so that they buy and regret later . So lets talk about this keyboardDurability - WORST i noticed a slight input lag on day 1 and some keys delayed in registering , thought I was trippin at first or perhaps it would go over time, but it got worse over time.  Should have returned it on day 1(BAD EFFIN LUCK) , just in 3 months the keyboard is at the point where most of the keys wont register or double register. Even my membrane keyboard worked absolutely fine for 5 years,  just the rubber membranes went bad.Anti-ghosting: just a fluke, sometimes multiple key presses wont register.Wire- fine, unbraidedKey caps-fineSwitches - fine as expectedBody- metal, heavy, somehow has a cheap feel to itLighting- Not rgb, just backlit, awful predetermined key lighting which gets reset after every shutdown.Circuit- i guess the keyboard's main circuit is the problem it might be that's it build quality is poor or cosmic byte is clueless how to make a keyboard chip.I would suggest to save a little more and go with zebronics max pro, or a premium branded one if you could afford it. Coz if the keys don't register their is no point to any other feature.I regret not saving and buying this!

Don't be taken back by the reference images which make the keyboard look orders of magnitude uglier than it is. The keyboard looks okay and the typeface could definitely be improved. After all, keyboards are made to be touched, not looked at. Speaking of touches, the Outemu Browns aren't that crispy-tactile and the keys are a bit wobbly, though that doesn't deter a programmer from using this. At this price, the keyboard is worth every penny, given I'm migrating from a Logitech K380 membrane keyboard which was more expensive, had interference issues, key failures and sometimes typed by itself like it was posessed (and no, I never brought so much as a drop of water close to it). The keycaps are decent and I opened up the machine to see a beautiful circuit with very good soldering. The lack of non-volatile lighting memory is kinda annoying. After all, you need about five bits of storage and any decent microcontroller has a non-volatile store these days - meaning the manufacturer deliberately downgraded the software here to sell a pricier keyboard. I might desolder the backlight LEDs and forget that one. All to say, it'd be a fool's act to go for much pricier keyboards when they offer only slight improvements over this. The journey's only begun and I'll update in case anything relevant happens.

"If you like this review please press that helpful button"Review :---------Its a Good entry level mechanical keyboard. The swiches are blue so it have that satisfying click sound. Previously i had a TVS Gold barath keyboard which came with cherry blue swiches compared to those the swiches are not as good. But cosidering the fact that the TVS  no longer comes with cherry & the cheapest  cherry switch keybord cost over 4000rs this feels like a great buy for a fraction of money.  BTW i brought this for around 1600rs during amazon shopping festival.I would say its a must buy if you are still using membrane gaming keyboards. Mechanical ones last much longer and feels way better to type on.The major con i found on this keyboard is its lighting. There are some funky lighting patterns but there is no option to keep the backlighting to a single color. We can adjust the intensity of light and can use some predefined lighting patterns. I wish there was an option to keep all the backlighting to a single collor preferably blue or white.Overall i completely recommend this keyboard if you can get this under 2000
Pathetic product! Keys not working properly just within a month. Pressing them repeatedly misses every 4-5th click. What should i do now? Watch the video attached.

I liked its tactical feedback anti-ghosting functions, 6 color lights and different patterns of lights but its a bit heavy and the keys are raised a bit more that can attract dust particles more and more inside it. bought it for 1749 on Amazon but available for 49 rs less on its official website for only rs 1699. overall good mechanical keyboard at its price. fast delivery by Amazon. Considering the price it's one of the cheapest mechanical keyboard available on the market buy it has some flaws. I am a programmer and gamer(mostly csgo) and this keyboard has disappointed me. I have some problems(One of them is weird).1. Sometimes some keys dont register while typing and also gaming which is not acceptable.2. My laptop goes into a bootloop if I try to boot while this keyboard is connected.... weird3. Keys are tactile and loud but the feel and actuation point is not great but for the price its acceptable.

I have regularly used HP/Dell Wireless keyboards and wanted to switch to mechanical keyboard.I do casual gaming and lot of coding.This keyboard is compact and may take some time to get used to, but the typing speed is great for me with good tactile feedback.I have taken the brown switch version- I have checked by removing some keys, and it uses Outemu Brown switches.The sound is not as loud as blue switches (I am comparing with some videos I saw on Outemu blues). But if you smash the keys hard, they do make good sound.The keyboard panel is made of aluminium, cold to touch and the build quality seems excellent. Far better from all the plastic keyboard I have used. There is gold plated USB connector which seems will last long without rusting.I have checked all the keys and it is working fine. I will update the review after few weeks on my experience.The led lightings and effects are ok. I do not prefer the effects and keep all LEDs on. Though there are around 10 patterns if you prefer.ALSO, this I discovered late, there are more patterns if you press Fn+1, Fn+2 upto 6. Fn+1 lights up WASD, Esc and arrow keys so it is lights for minimalist gaming buttons. 2 through 6 lights up few more keys.The keyboard misses on few areas, but it should be no bother at this price point, but here they are:1. The lightning effect gets resetted each time you power cycle your system/ unplug and replug the keyboard. It starts with the annoying snake pattern mode. The brightness setting is also lost. So you have to set it up with Fn+Ins for effects and Fn+arrows for brightness again.2. The markings on keycaps are not too visible when leds are off. This should not be a concern for touch typists, but for me who hover their fingers on the keys, I have to keep the leds on permanently. Though on the lowest brightness.

This is a fantastic mechanical keyboard which for any 1st time user or even for someone who just types out long documents. The lack of individual RGB is surely a CON, you really need to think if buying a full RGB support keyboard is worth spending another 1,000 which is almost double the cost of this keyboard.I own Cosmic Byte CB-GK-16 which are Outemu Blue Switches while these are Outemu Brown Switches. The Brown switches are quite silent and very home friendly.They do miss out on the tactile feel, but I would rather have a keyboard that is much silent than noisy.The keyboard is quite easy to recommend at the asking price of Rs. 1799 - 10% = Rs. 1619Can't really go wrong with it. Anyone who is using a membrane keyboard and wants to try a mechanical keyboard this can be a good starting point.

I loved this keyboard a lot its build quality is great no flex. Has full aluminium body. The keys don't have a lot of wobble. The switches are amazing and satisfying.Rainbow look is cool and has 6 effectsThere are 2 cons thoughThe feet are not rubberised.(keyboard is heavy, not always a problem)The brightness isn't top notchAgain can't expect everything from a budget keyboard.If this your first mechanical keyboard it Is great though I would suggest to spend 700rs more and get the redgear one with kalih blue switches if it is in your budget otherwise, go for it.

Here is my One month usage review. This keyboard is good and really perfect has nice design that from gamers to typewriters everyone will like. Has some led back ligthing not RGB but someone from the keyboard community named it Rainbow though I am not getting that rainbow effect, seven colors of the rainbow are not present on the keyboard :DThe keyboard has decent typing feeling that normal new mechanical keyboard lovers will like but those who are using mechanical keyboard for many years surely will get something wrong in it. Being a mechanical keyboard users for 2 years I have found some glitches here and there. Let me type down below in order.1. The keyboard has loud tactile sound that needs to be greasing for lowering it's sound.2. The keyboard may sometimes for a micro seconds does not response which should not be present in any professional keyboard which will lead typos, I know this is a known issue of the chipset it's used. It will not break the keyboard though.3. Jixian blue switches are good but it does not provide the feeling of outemu while typing.My old keyboard had outemu swithches that really given me a nice smooth typing feel of which only 50% I am getting from this keyboard.As I have to write lots of thing on my computer that's why I got those problems but normal users will never able to find such problems.But if those problems be kept aside then I can really recommend it to anyone who wants to use mechanical keyboard, at least it has solid Jixian switches not like logitech mechanical that once break you are finished.It's good keyboard for its price and nice. New users once get it hands on will never able to detect such problem at all.

This is my first mechanical keyboard and I am loving it! I was explicitly looking for "Brown" equivalent switches as I was not sure about the sound factor of the "Blue" equivalent switches, having come from the common membrane keyboards and the usual laptop "Chicklet" keyboards in my college and professional life so far, but I was sure that I wanted to experience the "mechanical switch" based keyboard, having worked with them in my school days.Thank you Cosmic Byte for making this extremely value option available for people like me, especially with the "brown switch", which is an absolute rarity in India at this price point. And it is an extremely well made keyboard! Remember the movie fight scenes where a keyboard is used as a weapon? Well, this keyboard can actually be used there, it is so well made! And the finishing touches and details are great too, nothing to complain about. I work in IT and I have been using this as my primary keyboard for the past 2 months, and there have been no complaints. I have also been trying to improve my typing speed and this keyboard has helped me get over my past membrane keyboard based average of 38 wpm, I am at around 45 wpm right now, and I can clearly see a lot of room for improvements, I am sure that word count is going to grow significantly in near future.I bought this from Amazon, and it was delivered quickly as promised to my address, and was even replaced once at my request within the replacement window. I had requested a replacement as there was something loose within the keyboard that was making a clinking noise when the keyboard was moved, though there was no isue with the keybpard functioning. The relacement was done without any hassle from Amazon. At around 2k INR, this is a clincher. In fact, having used it for a couple of months, I wouldn't mind buying it at the stated MRP of 2.5k if I ever have to buy it again. I would obviously advise everyone to go for it, if you want to try the mechanical keyboard as an option to see if you really enjoy the feeling of one, and if it improves your productivity significantly, this is one of the best options to begin your journey -  it is a very well made keyboard, but it does not cost a bomb and if it does not go to your liking, you can still find a use for it as it does not make an unhealthy amount of noise (think office environment or late night work from home, or even as a gift to someone deserving, like a student in your family who scored really well in the exams). However, if it does go well (the most likely scenario), you will glean many pleasurable hours (hopefully years) of usage, not to mention the admirable glances and vocal compliments of all who witness it! It sure is a treat for the eyes, if nothing else, in all its back lit, effect filled presence on your table.I have worked with membrane keyboards that cost in similar figures (1k+ INR), and I would say this one is definitely more value than those (relatively) expensive membrane keyboards, solely in terms of the typing experience and expected longevity. You have to allow for a few days to let the "feel" settle in to really understand and appreciate the difference a mechanical keyboard makes. Though I have not worked with the more expensive ones marketed as "semi-mechanical", but I would say try out a mechanical keyboard before spending a bomb on a "semi-mechanical", especially this one with Outemu switches, which are one of the best, if not the best, value Kailh alternatives out there. I saw a lot of Youtube video comparisons to come to that understanding, as I am sure you would too before opting for this.The only reason to go for a membrane keyboard if you are willing to spend in the vicinity of 1.5k INR would be if you are planning to carry it around a lot (even then, I would say save your money and buy something cheaper, they are not worth more than 800 INR at the most IMHO, and even then, get a back lit chicklet one, they are the most sensible portable alternative), as this one is not meant for being carried around - it is heavy (as all mechanical keyboards are) and is best used at a stationary work station, not lugged around in a back pack. You can do it, if you really want to, but I wouldn't recommend it, considering the weight, and also considering what a beauty this is, I would say it doesn't deserve that "treatment" of being smothered in a backpack. If that is not making sense to you, just wait till you set your eyes on this beauty, and it will!

Build quality is excellent in price range but the main fault was key prints are not clearly visible look likes faded i dont know its only in my piece.I am reviewing it again yesterday my W,A,Sand D jeys stopped working only in 2 months tume what a bad thing it is . This is one keyboard I have not gotten completely used to, even after almost two months of use. Not sure why. I still miss keys or press the wrong one.The keyboard gave trouble from the beginning. The comma key was mostly stuck. No amount of prodding, cleaning would help... after a few hours it would be stuck again and it got worse. I was in touch with Cosmic Byte and they promised replacement, but not after a highly annoying requirement of sending them photos as well as a video of the malfunction. I asked them to keep it on hold as the process was tedious. They asked me to use the keyboard lock and unlock button a few times, and over a period, it helped. The comma key works fine now.As far as the rest of the keyboard is concerned, I find the keys a tad too resistant. Also, the font used to display the keys is highly annoying... needlessly stylised typeface cause issues. Keyboards should have simple types, so recognition is instant.Overall, the build seems good. Package graphics are unimpressive. There was a little device (a ring with two extensions) that looked like it was placed mistakenly. Only later I realised it was to be used to pull the keys out. I wish the manufacturers had devised a method of inserting it into the keyboard body for storage.Another annoyance is the lights are not truly RGB... but each 'zone' has different colours. So, if I want the entire keyboard to show only a certain colour of backlight, it is not possible.Keep in mind I am not a gamer, just a design professional looking for a decent keyboard without paying through my nose.

I purchased it when it was first available after pendamic i.e 4th Oct in Rs.2000. I am using it consistantly for above 8 hrs or more every day for my professional use. I buyed it just for typing experience and my accounts n operation work, need lots of calculation so number keys is also performing good and using it for my ofc use. I don't care about lighting effect coz i am touch typist and my avg speed is 55 wpm.I must say it is one of the best keyboard available in the market. Its also compact in size.The only Con i notices is it is slightly wobble or stabilization issue but don't spoil typing experience and keys are super soft and just need small force to register. Far better then chicklet key. Half pressed or lazily pressed also register the key.I don't like cleaky sound so i purchased brown switches which is from Outemu brand and it is also respectable brand in international market after Cherry switches. It's good over kaihl switches and can't be compared to gixian as per you tube videos and some research done about types of mechanical switches. So in short otemu is 2nd best after cherry switches. Go for it and far better typing experience than those chicklet keyboards

Okay, so if you are looking to buy your first mechanical keyboard then this is one of the better options. I opted for the Outemu Brown switch variant as the blue switches are just some cheap Chinese knock-off and I prefer brown for the lower sound but similar tactile feel.If you have only used cheap membrane keyboards this is a big step up for typing alone and for gaming it's in a different league.The only con I have felt so far is the somewhat limited spacing between keys. More expensive models like the Ducky ones from meckeys or Corsair or even the Zebronics one have slightly better spacing so easier to get used to and less typos.Will update this review if any build quality issues pop up but it is built pretty well with aluminium chassis. The cable is cheap though.Anyway, hopefully this review helped and surely it is bang for the buck as an entry level mechanical keyboard, far superior to membrane keyboards at this price point.

The S key is broken i have to press it 3-4 times at least so it can register . so disappointing  , really cuts the gaming experience .It turns out its common issue in mechanical keyboards , u can fix it by poring rubbing alcohol into the socket ," u can find the fix on youtube" . u can get rubbing alcohol from any medical store .

I received my keyboard yesterday and I love it. So far, it seems like a great deal and I'm very happy with it. I'm still getting used to a mechanical keyboard but it's not too hard. I've also come to appreciate the clicky nature of blue switches. When reading reviews, I noticed that a lot of people mentioned they received Jixian blue switches while the browns were typically always Outemu. Once I received the keyboard, I immediately took off a keycap to determine what switch I got and was surprised to see it was an Outemu switch! I checked a couple other keys and they all had Outemus. I'd assume that these Outemu switches are better than the Jixians, so keep this in mind. My only complaint with the keyboard so far is the fact that the function key symbols (such as volume up/down) are not backlit since they are painted onto the keycaps. I guess I will have to commit each function to memory if I want to use them in the dark.

I bought this because I wanted a cheap backup mechanical keyboard which looked decent. The package arrived yesterday in a taped up box. It definitely was opened and/or used before. I still gave it the benefit of the doubt and open it up. Just by looking at it I could say that it would have issues working, but still I had little hope that it might actually work.I plugged it in and it lit up fine, I noticed a cut on the ESC key, about 2 millimeters wide. The left key was stuck pressed. None of the keys worked, I tried disconnecting my other HyperX keyboard and tried this, it only lit up and nothing worked. Tried it on another PC and a laptop but still the same.If I had bought this a month earlier and if the function keys worked to change the pattern of lighting then I probably would have hung this on our Christmas tree. A decoration light which looks like keyboard, a shame that even the light pattern changing keys don't work. :-)I've asked for a replacement, will update when this review when I get my replacement.

After using this keyboard I'm never gonna use membrane keybs againButtons are buttery smooth.Adjustable light brightness good feature and light at full brightness does not disturb eyes.Primary use programming n regular office workUSB cable is long but non braidedThis is a 1st day review so can't say how durable it is.At 2000 rs it's a good buy.Brown switches. Bought it for my work and gaming needs. Excellent quality and tactile mechanical keys. I went with the brown outemu switches as I don't like click sound of blue switches. Overall a decently priced gaming keyboard. Don't think will ever switch back to membrane keyboard now. Only thing lacking is breathing light for the switches üò≠. Best one if this is your first mechanical keyboard!

PROS:For those who know to type without seeing the keyboard, this keyboard is a boon. You will never miss a key. the keys are very soft and deep and actuate early, so when typing fast you dont need to hit the bottom, and also it doesn't hurt the fingers unlike a chiklet keyboard with no height at all(those that are found on most laptops).You can remove the keys safely and easily for cleaning.CONS:could have included wireless for this price,and there is option to turn off the backlights blinking serially, but it will resume again after system restart.also, the letters printed on top of the keys are too dull and not visible in low light conditions.

Very sturdy, excellent build quality. Value for money. Mechanical blue switches work as they should. And the RGB is adjustable from the keyboard itself. Heavy enough and has rubber feet so that it doesn't slide. And the cable is also good quality with sufficient length. In my opinion this is the best true mechanical keyboard with a Number pad, that I could find at this price range. Would definitely recommend.

Nothing to complain about at the price point! If it had remembered the light effect it would been a great keyboard. It  is annoying to reset the light effect every time :(UPDATE: After using it for some days I found that the hardware on this keyboard is incapable of handling fast key strokes. When I type over 80-90 WMP, it becomes unresponsive for some microseconds, technically it leads to typos. I'm of the type who use keyboard 10x more than mouse. This is so disturbing. I got replacement but that too have the same issue. I've never noticed such a problem in any keyboard before.

Look I've been using it for like couple of months and For gaming : Fine (I play fortnite, minecraft, overwatch, GTA v and mostly Fps)The thing itself is pretty strong.The one thing I don't like even though I know it supposed to be this way is : the key's r not bright u can't see them at night or even in daylight, u have to turn on the LED lights all the time to see. Which is kinda annoying.But u know it's a mechanical keyboard with a very strong build u get what u paid for.The lights just leave them you'll get used it.

Original review: Been using TVSE keyboards since 25 years (that's right!) and was justifiably frustrated with the new cramped up laptop keyboards. This one does not disappoint and has the legendary feel of a "real keyboard" (old timers will empathize with this feeling). All in all, a no nonsense keyboard that works exactly as expected and does not disappoint especially at this price point.Update January 2021:A few months down the line, the keys W, A, S, Z X stopped functioning. Obviously I expected to find a service center or some kind of call center number to redeem the One year warranty. Shockingly, there is no such thing where you can get it done. All they have are sales agents and the only toll free number advertised on the website was non functional despite trying it for a week. Feel extremely disappointed with a brand like TVSE not bothering with post sales. They probably think that their (once) legendary brand name will last forever and they can get away with shoddy service...On my part, I will never trust TVSE products again.
The quality is very very worst, because the keyboard is very very very old and used. The keys are full of dust & rust formed in usb pin, almost used and old product. I returned back.

I was expecting more from tvs. This keyboard falls in the budget category. And there are some drawback in it.1. The keyboard in itself is small, the same size you would get for a 500 rs keyboard.2. No long backspace. A keyboard and that to a tvs should not cut back in this area, when backspace is the most used key, it becomes cumbersome at the beginning to go far for reaching the backspace key esp for people with small fingers.3. No hand rest.  Make sure u have a good table to mitigate this issue.Overall the keyboard is smooth (but not butter smooth). The keys function as intended, been using it for 4 to 5 months now and no problem. Apart from the drawbacks that is what you get in a budget keyboard.

Been using this since Aug 2020, and here is what I have to say:I needed a compact keyboard and mouse for my workspace since I use two screens, and I did ton of research on something that is reliable and I can pack it in my bag.The keyboard layout is compact but you will get used to typing on it. so no complains about the keyboard.The Problem is the MOUSE. It is an absolute piece of GARBAGE. Does not matter if the batteries are new or old, how close you are to the transmitter. It just does not work.Problems with the mouse:It lags a ton, and I am talking a LOT! It hiccups and keeps reconnecting. why is this a huge problem? Imaging you selected some items and you are drag-and-dropping, in the middle of your tasks it just dies and your whole selection is ruined.Today another problem surfaced and I had to write a review to prevent others from buying this:Scroll wheel does not work on light press, I have to press it harder than before and with the hiccups is suddenly works 4 times at once.This might matter to you depending on the size of your hands. I have large hands and the mouse is not comfortable at all, it is way too small for meIn Conclusion: Do not waste your money on this piece of trash

Initially, I had several problems because the response lagged, especially when doing CPU intensive work. That seems to have resolved somewhat over time, and I have no idea how or why. I have to clarify that the reason I bought this was to have a small footprint keyboard, so that I could also accommodate a drawing tablet on the right side. For that purpose, it works fine. One feature I really miss is the ability to use a function key or moderator key to convert some keys to a numeric keypad. As I require unicode characters, this is a problem. I understand that some mini keyboards allow converting some keys to number keypad. The mouse is a bit small for my likes, but then I don't use it at all.

GREAT PRICE. Typing is very comfortable. The size is very convenient for small desks. The battery lasts for a VERY LONG TIME, haven't replaced the cells in 2 years. However, sometimes suddenly stops working or keys type some other character. But the problem only occurred once and went away in 2 days.
Way to bulky for a mini keyboard... cheap looking ... utterly nonsense sense of color.Regretting the purchase
Very good build.Soft touch keys.Easy set up, plug and play.Beautifully bright colors.Worth the price.Comes with one receiver for both mouse and keyboard and 2 sets of aaa batteries.

It's a great product for home/office use. Very portable and light weight, can be carried around without any hassle. Single receiver for both keyboard and mouse so it won't use up USB slots. Keys are also positioned nicely for fast typing. Battery also lasts quite long. I've been using at for over a month now and haven't replaced them yet.Arrow keys are a little small though so for gaming it may not be the ideal choice. And multimedia keys can only be used by pressing Fn key. There is no option to change multimedia keys to primary.Overall great product.

I have been using this pair for a month now. INSIDE BOX- so the box comes with one mouse, one keyboard, four remote batteries and one USB port(for connectivity). After one month of use I haven't change the batteries they are still going so battery backup is good all you need two batteries for each. (There's a small slot in the mouse itself to store the USB). TO CONNECT TO THE SYSTEM ALL YOU NEED IS TO INSERT THE USB AND SWITCH ON THE MOUSE. Although the keyboard connects directly with the USB.GAMING- You can do moderate gaming with this but heavy is not meant for this. Plus it's compact so you'll find difficult to find the keys while intense gaming.TYPING- This is a compact size keyboard without num pad. It's easy to carry plus takes lass space in the bag. The keys are soft to type plus they are firm.BODY- The body is made up of good plastic material. It's feels sturdy while holding in hands. It has a rubber grip in the bottom for better grip on the surface you are putting it(basically your work table).Well taking about value for money I'll say getting this quality + connectivity+ wireless system. It'll be best offer to buy a compact size mouse keyboard set under ‚Çπ1500.

Lasts long. I own two sets, one is five years old and still works almost like brand new.I am writing this review on the second one I bought.This Keyboard has many things going for it.Its form-factor is small, but not too small. The key travel is not too less, which is a problem with smaller keyboards.Most buttons are not obnoxiously small, unlike some other keyboards.The wireless "Just Works". I've never had issues with it.Battery life is easily six months for the mouse (heavy use daily), more than a year for the keyboard.The scrollwheel also has great tactile feel and is "clicky" as it should be.The mouse is also exactly the right size, fits right within the palm of my hands.The black and yellow provides enough contrast, so you'll never have visibility in most cases unless you're typing in complete darkness.Both the keyboard mouse will trivially fit within most backpacks without a hassle, so can be easily carried around.If you get an USB OTG cable, will work well with phones/tablets as well (though you'll have to figure out where to mount the device).

Functional keys are working as expected.5. No lag when we type in the keyboard and works like a wired keyboard.6. Mouse is fully adjusted in my palm and comfortable to use.7. Mouse does not have the tracking light which is good to save the battery life.8. One Bluetooth receiver for both Keyboard and mouse making me to save the USB slots on my Laptop.9. No back light for the keyboard (Not a draw back as it will kill the battery life of keyboard)10. Small LED indicator on the power on/off button for both mouse and keyboard (Turns on when the keyboard or mouse is turned on and which will turn off after 5 to 6 seconds the keyboard/mouse is switched on)11. There are no adjustable clips to set the keyboard height, but it has some default height which is comfortable to use.12. Easy to carry the keyboard13. Not useful for gaming purpose.14. Keyboard is Light weight.15. The only thing is, it is made in china and need to see the life of the product. I used this on my recently purchased MacBook Air M1. I got a minor scratch on the lid and so started looking for cases. This one fit the bill. It was selling for 1300 and with few cash backs that was on offer by Amazon for I was able to get it for around 1100. I received it nicely packaged next day and it fit the MacBook Air M1 perfectly. I had to push a bit for the snap but nothing alarming. The golden colour is nicely visible through the clear case. They had also provided keyboard cover which is good if you are going to use it open in dusty environment. Also supplied was the trackpad protective layer and some plugs for the USB-C and headphone sockets. Nice touch. I mostly use my setup closed like Clamshell and this is very useful to keep the setup safe.

Overall a decent product with a good build.Pros:1. Good build quality.2. The " World Map" pattern on the case is beautiful and gives the laptop a funky look.Cons:1. Once the screen and base cases are fixed, the screen can't be taken all the way back due to the thickness of the cases. This is especially a pain when keeping the laptop on your thighs while sitting on a sofa/bean bag and working as the screen doesn't have the mobility to go right back.2. The base case clips the body only on one side (either left of right) and not both sides.3. The keypad silicon is meant for the 2019 air book model, not for the 2020 model. Another problem with the keypad silicon is the back light can't be seen once the silicon is placed on the keypad.

At the first glance I thought that this might ruin my MacBook but it turns out it fits well. I don't liked the keyboard cover to be honest as you can read from the title & apart from that lid cover makes it heavy so you will notice your screen sliding down backwards. This might damage device so use it at your own risk. Otherwise at Rs.1299 you can't go wrong with this as there is all sort of protection stuff provided like trackpad protector, keyboard cover, port protector, lids.

The keypad shown in the pics  resembles the colour of the case but I received a plain black colour keypad which was crushed between the two panels thus making it useless.Otherwise the colour and finish of the product is flawless. Fits fine but a bit more loose than it should be. I don't think it'll be durable for more than 6-8 months again depends upon the kind of a user you are.It is absolutely easy to remove. No hassles what so ever. Colour looks really good on the new MacBook Air.

Not worth it AT ALL and here‚Äôs why:1. I got this product a few hours ago and have barely used my Mac since I put it on and you can already see finger print marks2. The material is cheap plastic - was expecting some rubbery texture for grip but well. Failed.3. The bottom lid is flimsy - if you pick up your Mac aggressively, it‚Äôll come off slightly. It doesn‚Äôt fit well at all (I use the M1)4. Look at the keyboard guard - it‚Äôs a JOKE. The space key on the guard doesn‚Äôt consider that the actual space key on the M1 is HALF the size. So the space key on the guard covers the key adjacent to the space key as well.Won‚Äôt recommend you to burn 1300 bucks on this ridiculous product. Skip it.

This is such a nice product. I was skeptical choosing the green colour, but it turned out to be even better than the pictures. I am using it with my Macbook Pro and connecting it was seamless. Mac will ask your help to setup this keyboard and once done, you can use it like a normal keyboard. The keystrokes are lovely, there is good enough sound (not too loud) and the overall experience is very good. I type a lot and it doesn't hurt my hands after long typing sessions. I ordered this keyboard because I was in great need of one. It‚Äôs pretty cute and the colours fit perfectly with each other. This is the cheapest keyboard (of great quality) available on the market today and I loved this product so much that I simply had to write a review. It‚Äôs a one time investment that‚Äôll last seemingly forever if you look after it and works on batteries which are replaceable.GO FOR IT!!

I've wanted a fancy mechanical keyboard for so long. This one works just fine. The keys sound amazing. The colors are so pretty in real. The photos couldn't do justice. I actually wanted blue & green versions of this keyboard too but settled on this one cuz they look like yummy candies. Enough about the looks, this actually works pretty well. The mouse is perfectly sized and snug in your hands. It was a bit fast in the start but then I adjusted the settings in my laptop now it works just like how I wanted it to. The keys are a bit closely set together but you'll eventually get used to it. I mean this is my third day and (I write a hell lot of essays) I'm already used to it. I play a decent amount of RPG games too and I love using this keyboard for light gaming. One suggestion I have for the manufacturers is about the indicator lights.  They are placed on the slope of the rounded edge of the keyboard and I can't really sometimes see if the caps lock is on or not. But that's just a minor issue. Really love this product and highly recommend it. If i find anything I don't like about it in the future I will update the review.p.s forgive my lq grainy pics.

Generally this k4000m device is a slim thin form factor model. I will consider this as a good choice for professionals in typing. Almost 2 meter cable with thick outer braids, integrated multimedia is real help when you want to save time. Best buy after an overall usage review.

Consider me a worker who doesn't wanna annoy ppl around me with loud and noisy keyboard clicks. After returning multiple keyboards which were to work silent didn‚Äôt do so, i chose  K4000M and now i would say with full hope on the brand, this is the chosen one. Simple and well structured design for a full sized keyboard. The key spacing is exact without much gaps, the fingers are well reachable. Braided cable looks and feels rigid, with a well mouled USB connector. Key press feel with the chiclet feel is real add on value, soft on finger tips. Easy connectivity with your PC or Laptop directly without USB hubs, coz the cable is of 2 mtrs. Approx. Multimedia keys are of good use, helpful at times. 5star rated keyboard for sure.

Quick review for looking out to buy soft feel keyboards, this one is a gem. Zebronics IT goods are famous for ages, this one's a keeper of it. No clicking noise trouble, comfortable without finger fatigue and design is flaw free, with a pretty long braided cable.

Writing this review is very emotional for me as I had to bid goodbye to it today. It was like an extension of my body for over 2 YEARS. It was one of the best keyboards I have used.I bought it in January of 2017 for ‚Çπ2000. Since then this keyboard has gone through a lot of torture. I play games a lot and many times I would hit the keys brutally during intense moments (READ RAGING). Nothing happened to it though. During it's service, it had tea/water/cold drinks spilled on it multiple times. Cleaning the keyboard and drying it was more than enough to get back at playing. The RGB Light intensity didn't reduce over the years. The Blue light is exactly the same as that of Logitech so it paired well with my G300S and G402. The Red is the same as that of the fans of my case so it was a match there too.Here are some of the PROSThe FN Keys are really handy along with swappable "WASD" and ARROW KEYS.The Wristrest is big enough and although made of plastic does not irritate the skin.It's a silent,"laptop like" keys. Great for late night gaming.The keys are spaced apart perfectly FOR MY HAND SIZE. So no fatigue over long durations.But it has a few CONS too.Some of the keys (Spacebar, Backspace, etc) are not completely lit and it looks kind of bad but they are not easily noticeable.The RED BAND along the bottom stands out when the keyboard lights up in some other color.The Numbers in the NUMPAD never worked for me. Might be a software problem.To conclude, I would say that if you are not head over heels for Mechanical or "Mechanical Feel" keyboards, this is a good and durable keyboard.

Positive:1. RGB works2. Keyboard has a nice matte finish3. The keys are soft to press and overall responsive4. The logo is nice addition5. Price - and it was a lesson (dont buy cheap)Cons:1. The size of the keys is unconventional, i play CS GO and when replacing my lenovo keyboard assumed that the manufacturer will follow standards prevalent. But herein the keys are larger than normal which resulted in me having to change my game play (cannot duck anymore or in the middle of a busy firefight i end up on my windows desktop page!)2. Return policy of Amazon requires the product to be defective, damaged or not functioning. Hence i cannot replace this useless piece of junk because Amazon is more than happy to ship this back to me, albeit in a new packaging. When your product isnt in line with the prevalent manufacturing standards you (Amazon) need to have an option to return the product and for pete's sake just provide store credit if not a refund.Very disappointed Amazon.3.
My first gaming keyboard very good experience this keyboard thanks Amazon and redragon i love you

I bought this keyboard for my second computer, which I use for typing. My main computer already has a Razer Huntsman Mini. I do a lot of typing and I have a high speed of about 110WPM(Words per minute) I know that I should have bought a Mechanical keyboard because they are fast at typing, But I just found this Shiva keyboard and I bought it because I have used Redragon's Phaser mouse as a budget temporary mouse so I thought let's buy a budget gaming membrane keyboard that also has macro keys. Even though it only cost me only about Rs2000 which compared to the Huntsman which cost over Rs14000 this keyboard exactly felt like I was typing in a Huntsman this is so good. Upgrading from a mechanical Dragonwar keyboard in a pandemic lockdown.I chose The Redragon Karura K502 as it was affordable and I love a good matt finish on keyboards although it is very difficult to keep it dust and stain free.Also, I've never done serious gaming (FPS games) with a membrane keyboard which has island style chicklet type keys. It looks very sophisticated. It is one of the quietest keyboards I've used come across and would highly recommend it for someone who has to type a lot and does not quite like the clickety-clack sound of keys. As of now I don't find any issues with the space bar key not registering or the enter key being too small or far away for the right pinky finger as noted by some fellow owners of this keyboard.It does take some time to get used to typing on it as the keys are spaced out (low profile membrane keyboard, much like them Apple Macbooks) but i believe that happens with every time one changes keyboards.Backlight on the lazer engraved letters on the key caps is not uniform but its definitely better than what I was using, so no complaints there for me. Font could have been better.I received the keyboard one day earlier than its scheduled delivery. Thank you Amazon India.

So don‚Äôt get fooled by razer and get this one.

I had surfed the net for a good gaming keyboard within a budget limit of INR1500 (because I am not a pro gamer, I just use for coding and mid-level gaming). To my luck, I got the Redragon Karura K502 in the set limit (Festive offer). Came in good packaged condition, bubble wrapped, a user manual and a Redragon sticker.Pro-1. Has all the customizable RGB functions as specified in the description, the keys sound pretty decent and are very responsive, delivering good feedback that is satisfying during gaming sessions.2. The braided cable and gold plated USB pin is to be mentioned as a very good option to be included as none of its other competing counterparts offer them.3. The wrist rest is also to be highlighted because no other keyboard in this range offers a good space that supports wrists during longer usage periods.4. The undersurface has three rubber grips for arresting any sort of keyboard movement against the table or wherever it is placed.My overall rating for the keyboard is a 5/5. I wouldn't spend a lot going for high end stuff and this keyboard has covered all of my expectations. All I would be worried (if I have to be) is the key life, but I've known it to be a durable product as a person has been using it for 2 years and still going strong. Recommended product.

This is a gorgeous keyboard! I haven't tested it completely, but preliminary use was very good. The switchable backlight feature is great! The different colors are amazing. Plus I wanted a low profile keyboard to relieve pain while typing with a traditional keyboard. The only thing missing are the right Windows key and the context menu button (the one that appears as a list next to the right Windows key on a traditional keyboard). I'll provide an update later.

The keyboard has a very good mechanical feeling to its keys. Rubberised texture truly elevates the look. RGB is really great. Looks really good, evenly distributed and has a lot of modes to play with. It even has a dedicated software. The arm rest is easily detachable and is also good looking. I have been using the Redragon Karura K502 keyboard for a year now. I bought this for 1249 rupees. This seems like a copy of Razor Death Stalker keyboard which is more expensive one.So they made two version of this keyboard. The one which I got is the new version. I will tell you what they improved in the new version, you can watch reviews on youtube for the old and new one. To distinguish the new one is the see the transparent stripe on the space bar. The new version of the keyboard has a short stripe on space bar as compared to the long stripe.In the older version , keys were mushy and inconsistent. Like for example , keys were hard to press and the space bar was not uniform ( if the press keys from the end point , they might work , you had to press in the middle). The new version improved on this one. It seems they added some reinforcement down there so if I press the space from the end point , the whole thing goes down and work.Using for a year , a key started to malfunction. For me the right arrow key registers more input even if I press it ones. I will press the right arrow key one time and it will register like 15 or 20 key strokes which is definitely very annoying sometimes. Sometimes this issues resolves itself and sometimes this issues comes back. So I never thought of complaining to support service. Other than that all keys works fine.One things I noticed , I used the Dell chiclet style keyboard and the keys over there are hard to press. while on redragon keyboard , I really like the keys on this one , atleast on the new version. They are soft to press and It gives me pleasure of some sort typing on this thing right now.For me , this keyboard is really good typing, it takes a while to get it used to as the never used a chiclet style keyboard. This keyboard is silent but not that silent , over the year keys are making more sound , my space bar makes a buzzing sound idk why , maybe the spring or the enforcement down there.Some of the cons I noticed are :if your device loosed power , it will go back to the original lightning effect , the rainbow flashing one which i am not a fan of . So everytime when I trun on the pc , I have to cycle through the color which I like.If your keyboard is provided power if the pc is in sleep mode , the color will not change.One major con is the back light on this keyboard.  Light Color are not accurate, if the put it on the yellow light effect , some keys are not yellow but reddish and it is issues with most color. the red , blue and green does not have this problem but other color especially if you want to use white color only, some keys , like left most or arrow keys lookes  red which really bothers me. I think this is the deal with every model out there.If someon1e out there is thinking that this keyboard will not acquire dust , maybe you are right but dust can definitely get under the keys , but the thing I like is that dust will not get under the actual circuit board as there is some leverage under the keys.I love this keyboard except that malfunctional key and the inconsistent light on this . Other than that I love typing on the keyboard and palm rest is quite good too.PS : I not a big gamer , I don't know much and test that gaming functions but I don't care about those things.

Others have already listed the pros of it, so I will not go into that.My primary concern with this keyboard is that the CTRL+L-SHIFT combinations did not work.The first time I received this keyboard, I thought this might be a fault in the unit itself, replaced it, got the same defect once again.Looking up online, this seems to be a common issue with this keyboard (might be an inherent defect itself).For me, most of my work revolves around keyboard-shortcuts, many of which are CTRL+SHIFT combinations (I am a programmer).  Yes, you can circumvent this issue by using the R-Shift button, but I do not want to change my habits because of this one single model.Even the cheapest keyboard I have used so far (350‚Çπ) supports these combinations.

The keyboard protector works as advertised. It's great to block out dust particles from entering the keyboard, it has a soft touch and it cancels out the typing noise of the keyboard. The transparent protector which I purchased is also good for the backlit keyboard of the HP Pavilion x360 14-ba073tx for which also it fits perfectly. The only difference between 14-ba075tx and 14-ba073tx is the CPU, rest everything is same. I've been using this product for almost 2 weeks now and I am quite satisfied with it. I purchased this from Amazon at Rs. 355. I'm sure it might be available in local shops for a cheaper price but Amazon provides service and replacement (in case of wrong product, etc) which local shop owners are not able to provide. Also, almost every time I enquired locally, it was not available in shops and they advised me to buy it online.

Had purchased a Dell KM117 wireless keyboard+mouse combo last year. So this is a review comparing both.Keyboard* The keyboard is not exactly compact, but hey, it's a full layout with the number pad, so it's expected to be big.* Keys itself feel like cheap plastic, and a bit wobbly. Can hear kind of a rolling dice sound while lifting the keyboard up! :) Compared to an old HP PS/2 keyboard, these keys feel cheap.* No capslock/scrolllock/numlock LEDs.* People who love a standard QWERTY US-EN layout should be okay with this one. The Dell KM117 keyboard had a better feel to the keys, however it didn't have the right click menu key, Print Screen only with Fn etc.Mouse* Mouse is a decent one - considering the price range. Comparing the Dell/Logitech mice I had used over years, the movement is very smooth.* It also has a CPI button for adjusting the sensitivity.  Could be useful for gamers.* What appeared to be side grips on the photograps are not rubber, it's plastic again.All in all. 4/5. Go for it if you'r looking for a cheap keyboard/mouse combo.
