Having used professional graphics drawing pen tablets at work for image manipulation and for free hand drawings, I wanted to buy one for home use to complete assignments and work on my hobby projects. My considerations were that the tablet should not need repeated charging and should be packed with all the professional features i could get in my budget. After careful consideration and research on numerous brands and models and comparing features I shortlisted and purchased the Huion H610 Pro V2 from the renowned Huion stable. I've worked on Huion tablet models before and have found them to be good. I've received, configured and used the product for a few days and my research and decision have paid off and below are my observations and review for it.Looks, Feel and Functionality:‚óè The Huion Inspiroy H610 Pro V2 came in a professional branded box with the Tablet and all the accessories neatly packed and organised. The box top is foam cushion lined on the inside for protection and contents include the Huion H610 Pro V2 tablet, the Battery-Free pen PW100, the mini USB cable, the pen holder and the 8 pen nibs cleverly housed inside the screw open pen holder and the quick start guide.‚óè The Tablet looks sleek, smart and stylish. I feel that the working area is really good and is ample space to work on, for any creative project. The soft pad below the tab gives it an anti-slip strong grip on any surface and keeps it fixed to assigned spot. The last thing you want is for the tablet to move or shift while doing delicate work. The tablet itself is really lightweight making it portable. There is a green indication light above the 8 vertical express key shortcut console. On the top horizontally are the 16 Hot cell soft keys which can be configured for ease of use. Connectivity is using the Mini-USB that is provided and the tablet draws power from the connected laptop/desktop and there is no charging of tablet required separately. I really appreciate that the slot for the Min-Usb cable is shouldered by the device itself creating a immovable connection with the cable and protects both the slot and the cable from damage. Durability ensured for a long time.‚óè It took me just around 10-15 minutes to get used to the pen and start using it creatively as an extension of my hand. Pen movement is smooth and gliding without any jitters or disconnects and the movement is very smoothly translated to the screen with no perceptible lag. The pen features double customisable press keys for switch brush and right click button. One of my requirements and favourite features is the fact there is no charging required. It can frustrating to be in the mood to work and then waiting hours for devices to charge, so that problem is totally resolved for me. Just connect and get to work. Although I don't see the nibs wearing out frequently, they have provided 8 additional nibs so that it takes care of replacement requirement for many years as per my estimation. They're neatly arranged and hidden inside the pen holder which can be screwed open to access them. The bottom of the pen holder also has the provision to properly remove and replace the nibs and there are small neat diagrams on the bottom of the pen holder illustrating the exact process to follow.‚óè Configuration is easy and convenient. I'm using a Macbook pro on MacOS Sierra 10.12.6 so I could use even without downloading the drivers. However I will upgrade OS and the device drivers soon. Currently they need to be download from the Huion website (link to download is provided on quick start guide) and I feel that Huion could have provided the drivers on CD/DVD for quick access. However I'm only saying this as my Macbook Pro features a DVD slot and I see how pointless it would be for the Mac Air models which don't have a DVD slot or for the latest PC versions which don't either. With the all systems online with high speed internet and huge data limits, I don't see this as a big problem.‚óè This Review would be incomplete without mentioning the 2 big features that make this tablet tower head and shoulders above other brands and models. The ¬±60-Degree pen tilt function is uncommon in other tablets and the latest in the cutting edge technology which Huion has incorporated in their latest offering. This product comes with tilt recognition function on the pen which is the key in providing better pressure detection and accurate cursor position depending on the different angles you're positioning the pen at. Excellent for free hand drawings and art work. Creatively, it is bang on target giving enhanced control and gives you more accurate drawing experience as per your liking. I am also pleasantly surprised with the 8192 pressure sensitivity which is almost double of other normal tablets and is highly responsive and feels very natural. The combination of the tilt function and the 8192 sensitivity gives you control over the greatest artistic expression you could have on a digital input device. I'm simply blown away by the functionality this brings to my artistic work.‚óè I am regularly using the tab now with Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator effortlessly. It is also compatible with numerous other software including Corel painter, Manga studio, clip studio, Zbrush, Krita, Gimp to name a few. The Huion Tablet comes with a 1 year warranty and a renowned customer care acclaimed for their quick and reliable support, for peace of mind.Verdict:With a reasonable price range when compared with other tablets and models, the latest features functioning in tandem with some great hardware, this professional graphics drawing pen tablet holds it own against some of the best names in the business. Needless to say, I'm very impressed with the looks, multi-functionality and great artistic licence this device provides. I'm really enjoying working on this and will recommend this without hesitation. Go for it.

I'm a digital marketer and a part-time doodler and I've to conduct several presentations for my company. I got my hand on this new range of Huion H610 of version2.; that remarkably defines my presentation with ease. With PowerPoint to taking quick annotation is a great time saver with using this tablet.I got my tablet in prompt delivery and installed latest Huion driver from their website, as box consists one battery-free pen; which has 8192 pressure sensitivity that is excellent to use with lightweight ergonomic design and tablet itself has robust built quality and premium finish that features 8 customizable express buttons on the side and on the top it has 16 hot cells for more advanced user. The drawing area of 10"x6" gives extensive drawing space to work; also the cool pen holder which comes with 8-extra nibs; that's kind of sweet from the Huion brand.This newer iteration of H610; has OTG functionality, but package includes no OTG dongle inside as you can buy it separately as I did, bought it outside to connect it easily via my phone. I use Android device of Android 8.1(Oreo) version; as no more hitch in connecting via Pc or laptop; as I can go light with this tablet; that makes it portable-friendly. As its support, great drawing app like Sketchbook, Medibeng, Photoshop sketch, Bamboo paper, and Pen Up to name a few.In my field of expertise,¬† I do have to use lots of Infographics and design in Photoshop for a quick mockup for the ads. Also evaluating the designs and making speedy amendments is speedier than ever with having this tablet. With this tablet, I can select a faster image selection within Photoshop. The¬† Powerpoint slideshows and animations are faster to execute too.In a nutshell, this tablet has extremely practical usability that is available in the genuine rate at the market over the other counterpart available in the market. It certainly defines the work process into a whole new horizon; I'm truly content as I own this tablet; I truly recommend to you all.

Disclaimer! This is my first drawing tablet so cannot really claim it to be the best. The tablet has some nice features, like chargeless stylus. The pen holder is also very nice. Would have loved if this had a usb-c cable, which are more common nowadays. The tablet surface is smooth, I tape a A4 sheet of paper to get the right feeling.  The plastic nibs wear out very fast, but if you keep rotating them while drawing, they will work fine. At Aliexpress you can get a bunch of these nibs for a 100 bucks. make sure to download the appropriate drivers before using the tablet. I particularly love the size of the tablet since it perfectly replicates the 14 inch laptop that i use along with it. If you are like me and want to test out drawing tablets, you can give this brand a try.

This is a very good product from Huion. Finish is good. Working area is quite big and good for use it for PC or Laptop and even Mobile. The pen doesn't reuire any charge, so there is no need to worry. The tilt feature is also handy and the pen runs smooth on the working area. Good craftmanship, good functionality and ease of operation. The pen holder is also uniquely designed to keep the extra nibs inside with a nib extraction hole. This Graphic Dwarong Tablet is a very good start for the graphic designers. Works flawlessly with vast Drawing programs in various OS. No doubt a Value for money product.Update: Wow, even while in Phone mode, you can use the entire area of this Graphic Tablet in 'Samsung Notes' App for drawing and even handwriting.

I have received the order just one hour before writing this review. The package was nicely handled by the Amazon and I am impressed with the quality of service they are offering their customers.Talking about the need for a mechanical keyboard would be like I am a professional content writer and work most of the time writing contents for clients as well as for myself. I do have a blog and around 10-12 hours are spent on writing and editing things.I have used membrane keywords before having this Zebronics max plus mechanical keyboard and upgrading with a mechanical keyboard suffice my need for my content writing works.The first unboxing experience was splendid and spending 2.5k for a keyboard is huge for me. Anyways, I did not have any mechanical keyboard before but this time I have thought to buy one because the Membrane keyboards are not that fit for writing an intensive work.Like, I said I can't STOP writing with the keyboard. I really don't know about the keys but it feels so awesome. They are soft, delicate and require a minimal amount of force to register any letter pressed on the keyboard.The RGB lighting effects are good and but one thing that I did not like about this keyboard was the Printing on the KeyCaps. I am not complaining about the keyboard but its just a suggestion to Zebronics to make the prints on the keyboard more appreciable.Other than this the keyboard has an awesome built quality regardless of plastic built didn't seem to have compromise on the quality of switches or feel in any way.Above all the Quality is top notch with that said I just need it to work for few years as typical mechanical keyboards seem to work for few years in general.I will also see if any issues used over the time and I will continue to update the review as per my time frame. Till then, I find this useful to Typists, writers, Bloggers or Programmers.I can say Zebronics is one of the leading Tech Manufacturers here in India. And, if anything goes wrong you can simply move to them with the keyboard, a standard 1-warranty is specified as per my opinion.--------------------------------------UPDATE AFTER A MONTH------------------------------------------------------------ I am updating the review after a month of rigorous usage of this keyboard. This is to know that I am absolutely loving this keyboard and its typing experience. Well, I need to speak to all the peoples thinking to buy this keyboard from amazon.I guess the height of this Mechanical Keyboard is high enough if you're having short hands, there may be issues to reach out to the top of the keyboard. Now, this has been has been a real pain for me for few days but I ignore it completely because of awesome typing experience.Even after writing millions of words in a month or so.. I did not feel any depression on keys. I do like the tactile feel that it offers through out the session. Not only that it's my first mechanical keyboard so hardly knows about other ones priced higher than this.Zebronics offer good back-lighting that does not hit the eye more of a sober to eye. I bet you will never return to usual keyboard after having used to Zebronics keyboard.That's the saddest part because I have to carry this keyboard along with my laptop just because I don't like membrane keyboards.The only thing could make this keyboard a big big hit is including a palm rest with it.Yes! It does feel little pain after being used to this keyboard. The keys are little raised but offers nice tactile feedback that's what a user expect from a mechanical keyboard.----------------------------UPDATE AFTER 4 MONTHS OF USAGE------------------------------------------Now, when I say things are pretty good with this keyboard even typing was the only purpose for me that insisted me to grab this keyboard. Despite of heard lot of good stuffs about TVS GOLD I did not like over all look and who don't want a back-lit LED. If I am paying the same price for both. Shouldn't I use pick Zebronics?Coming to feel and typing experience after 4 months of usage. It's still feel the same no matter how much you type through out the day. The only thing I want Zebronics to include is a palm rest or make one for separate purchase. I couldn't find one in the market.The typing experience and the sound steals everyone heart. With accurate and precise typing I am glad that Zebronics made such a low cost mechanical keyboard within a budget.I am extremely happy with the keyboard. Just not I want myself to be happy with a mechanical keyboard. For me (a content writer) knows how difficult it is to go beyond 2k in a membrane keyboard.Your hands feel much of strain and as a result you'll feel fatigue after sometime. The reason behind buying a mechanical keyboard was to let my fingers can take rest without the fatigue.Gaming is super fine with the keyboard with precise tap gets registered very easily no issues with Anti-ghosting I have even tried checking this from Google and It came to notice it can register more than 20 key press at a time. I have played PUBG and few other and used the Fn+windows to lock the windows key while gaming.

Hey All,I have been using logitech Bluetooth keyboard for last one year but off late I longed for a mechanical keyboard.And my dream to own one, came true recently. So, here's the first impression.DESIGN:-It is a full fledged keyboard with 104 keys and 12 additional multimedia keys.-It has bright LED RGB backlit keys which look so elegant and so energetic and fun to work with.-It comes with outemu blue switches which means that with less efforts you will be able to write with much accuracy and halfway through the keys are pressed making your typing faster.-These keys produce clicky sounds that most software engineers/coders/programmers and Gamers love.BUILT QUALITY :-It wieghs 1.5 kgs which means that the keyboard is heavy and it will not be moved from its place easily. You can type as fast as you want without any worry of being disturbed.-Cable length is super long 1.9 meters. You will see the cable same as electric  iron cable that we usually have at our homes.-So, overall my experience with this keyboard is extremely good.All I can say is if you are looking for affordable yet an expensive looking keyboard under INR2500 just go ahead.Please vote helpful if you liked my review.Stay happy keep smiling :)

This product I bought for 2k around. the keys are Kailh - Chinese version of cherry blue.Do it creates a difference? No . The other mechanical keyboards are of 5k to 10k. This one is bang for the buck.Membrane Keyboard < Laptop Keyboard < Mechanical KeyboardNow when  I have to type on laptop keyboard, I feel like why this is not getting pressed more. The feeling and joy of typing on this keyboard is amazing. I can type many pages easily with this.The Back Kick Stand on the back broke out while being used, this keyboard is very heavy and solid so they are not able to handle it. It happened within my warranty. Did I replaced it? No, I closed the kick stand and worked without it. after some days another one broke too - Now both are opened up and lifted my keyboard firmly.Why I didn't replaced? that was not a big issue to me and I was lazy to wait for the next one to come and return this one just for a kick stand. all the keys were working fine for me and the sound is like WOW. so Skipped replacement and kept working on it. 5 months have gone. Still its my best purchase as a developer- next is iPad to it.Thanks for reading. Hope it helps

Extremely disappointed by this purchase. Barely 2 months in the keys started repeating letters. I‚Äôm not a gamer and I only bought the keyboard for the light effects. So I was very happy for a month and then the repeating keys started. Do you have ANY IDEA HOW LONG IT TAKES to type an email when one alphabet randomly repeats? I used to own a Zebronics keyboard earlier and that never gave me any trouble. I guess times have changed. I will not buy anything from these guys again. I have had bad experience with Zebronics earlier, especially with their frequently failing SMPS and some cheaply made speakers. The cost is more than what I would have paid for a normal keyboard but this gaming keyboard provides bang for the buck. I bought this keyboard after saw the picture on Amazon. I felt the keyboard will be sturdy and compact, but it's not sturdy at all ( though we don't don't expect more in ‚Çπ250/- ). But after received the keyboard I discovered it doesn't comes with "HOME" and "END" keys ( see in my listed picture) . Received keyboard was completely different from listed product picture on Amazon description page. This keyboard comes with dedicated Indian rupee symbol key which also doesn't work and manufacture company ( Live Tech ) helper don't have any idea how to use this rupee symbol key in any writing applications like MS Word, Excel, Notepad etc. I don't recommend to buy this keyboard because it doesn't has 2 major keys like Home and End.

Fewer of us now require a dedicated number-pad on our keyboard, and more of us are operating in tight-cramped spaces. I have always used external keyboards with my Laptops, not just to reduce the wear and tear, but also for reasons of ergonomics.I have shifted to using Laptops instead of Desktop computers at my SOHO, simply because a) they take less space, b) they can be shifted around and even locked up, c) they take less power, less air-conditioning, and generate less noise.Adding an external keyboard helps me a) save the life of the keyboard on the laptop, b) position the keyboard below the laptop in a more ergonomic manner. After all, replacing the keyboard on my Acer Laptop costs Rs.4500/- and this keyboard costs 450/-. The math is simple. In fact, this keyboard is compact enough to be put into the laptop bag just in case I have to work on client site for a few days.Entirely made of plastic, featuring rubber/silicone key-press mechanism, don't expect the keyboard to generate soft clicks and gentle feedback. It feels mushy to type, and the keycaps are clackety. But they get the job done without any fuss.The keyboard comes with a range of multimedia keys which I use rarer than rarely. Unfortunately, the keyboard is missing the 'Home' and 'End' keys which I use frequently. The keyboard also comes with a 'Num Lock' and 'Scroll Lock' key which defies logic. I used the excellent freeware 'SharpKeys' to simply map the useless keys into more useful keys on Windows 10 and solved my problem.Unlike some of the other models of similar compact keyboard, this model has full-sized Arrow keys and this was the primary reason why I opted for this model. After using it for a few months, the writing on the keycaps tends to get rubbed off and the key-tops tend to erode a bit. The keyboard itself works faultlessly though, becoming quieter and smoother.Let me know if this was helpful.
As expected premium feel budget keyboard with inr ‚Çπ rupee symbol integration. Completely satisfied with the purchase and the on time amazon delivery ü§ó. GO for itüëå

Because that is of 500 bucks and this one is five times costlier than that. The size of TVS Gold Bharat USB wired is big enough. More than it would have been awkward and uncomfortable.In looks, the keyboard is sturdy, solid and strong and in operation, it is soft and melodic key typing sounds. It is not noise if one likes the keyboard and if not then the sound is noise and size is absurd.I urge the sellers to upload the product images so that the customer could have a good look of product from angles to make the decision to buy. I also urge my fellow customers to please upload product images for being helpful to others. Hope mine will help someone else.The keyboard is as good as shown on the webpage in the product image. I thought the model must be older. But to my surprise, it is manufactured in Feb. 2020. Above all TVS electronics is Karnataka based company which make this keyboard an Indian product so on that count also I feel good to have this.It is with a USB keyboard. MRP is Rs. 2770 and I got at Rs. 2568/- as Appario Retail was selling more than it.Only thing i fear is that the colour of keywords on keys is less bright compared to other but that do not affect it's working.My views are that the product must go on for years and for such a product some cost has to be paid. I have two other regular mechanical keyboards lighter in weight and good performance, but this one has no comparison. This keyboard is not a 'use and throw' hardware. As I said it will get old with me. Hopefully I will need another mechanical keyboard in year 2030. Get it and forget to purchase any keyboards for years to come.

I wish to return the item as it is a low quality item and nothing close to what a "classic" original TVS Mechanical keyboard should be. It has some inferior quality switches (Lung Hua make) and not the Cherry MX Switches that the original classic make used. This item was delivered on 22 June but I could check the item only today as I was out of town and due to COVID lockdown there were no options to reach home earlier. I reached home today in the morning and today in the afternoon I opened the item and I am not happy with the product and hence want to return. But unfortunately the return window closed yesterday and Amazon would not allow me to return the item. I request the seller to take a note and help me with a possible return.

I had to return this keyboard.Just for context I use a CoolerMaster keyboard with cherry MX brown switches. I needed another keyboard for office but was looking for a cheaper alternatives with mechanical switches.This keyboard provided a great typing experience given the price point but I had to return it because it didn't matched three of my usecases.1. It's very big and bulky, it takes up a lot of real estate on my table where i keep dozen other things.2. The Chinese blue switches were pretty awesome in typing but very loud for my office use.3. The backspace button was small, I use it a lot and prefer it wider like in other standard layouts.Although the built quality is not that sturdy and can easily flex but i felt pretty confident that it would last long.Overall i would suggest to give this keyboard a try as it provides great typing experience with good tactile feedback without burning a hole in your pocket. It just didn't workout for my usecase.

I was bit apprehensive since the key switches are not from original cherry mx manufacturers. However it turns out that the keys do have good tactile feedback and true mechanical feel. Happy with the purchase. Feels solid and durable.The only thing which bothers me is the missing Fn key. It should be possible to map the "Menu" key to "Fn" key using OS specific key mapping software ... but that will be a hassle. That is the only reason it has lost 1 star.EDITED ON 9 Feb 2021The key "R" was giving problems for past few months, I had to apply extra pressure to make it work and today it stopped working completely! I bought this on 12 Feb 2020, so I have 3 more days to claim 1 year manufacturer warranty but there is no TVS service center in my town and not sure if it is even worth it. The cherry MX like keyswitches are not user replaceable and local shop could not repair it. Though there is no issue with all other keys, I was hoping to replace the defective key with one of the number pad keyswitch but it is not designed that way. One important reason to buy mechanical keyboard is it's reliability too but looks like the keyswitches used are not high quality cherry MX switches but of some low quality. So I have reduced my rating to 2 stars.

Best on budget gaming mouse-keyboard combo for gamers who like minimal design.Used it for about a month and I haven't found any defects in my piece.Connectivity ,latency issues,DPI, keystroke sensitivity everything is perfectly fine.Note that this is NOT A MECHANICAL KEYBOARD, its a membrane keyboard , but not that bad . For gamers like me , this combo amazes with its looks.Forward and backward button feels a bit clicky and sometimes cheap too but it doesnt malfunction.Presence of 4 levels of DPI is really useful from accurate sniper shots to close range head on combat !!The braided cables do lift up the looks of the keyboard and mouse, making it look not so cheap.~~~But one thing i should mention is the rgb lights in the keyboard DO NOT LIGHT UP KEY LABELS , but thats not something we can complain about in this price range . Sometimes i find it difficult to type even small phrases when the room light goes off.But again , this piece offers more features than its value.Overall this is the BEST BUY in this price range.Dont overthink JUST GO FOR IT .For gamers unlike me who like the "catchy" gaming designs , ZEB TRANSFORMER is one best choice , i bought that too and it is exactly the same as this except for the cool graphics on the design.The forward and backward buttons in zeb transformer feels different and more comfortable than this.

Looks amazing. Colors are nice and bright. Software takes around 2 seconds to register the changes. The only major concern about the keyboard is that the Spacebar key need to be hit harder for it to register. And the buttons are gloss plastic with the inside of the keys visible. Rest everything is as expected and better.Will give it a 4.5/5.These are initial thoughts.. Will give a full review as time passesEdit-Been using the keyboard for almost 10 months now. Following are the observations.If you are using a programmable mouse along with this programmable keyboard. There are chances that the drivers may interfere with other devices causing in very bad ghosting. Some keys pretend to be held even if they are not. For example if you are typing a sentence and press a letter "M" for a split second it will consider as if you were holding "M" and give you "mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm" until you press the key M again.Sometimes the button 6 just doesn't register after being it.Sometimes the Keys "WASD" stop functioning all of a sudden.The issue for the above problems is due to the software and specifically the "gaming mode" feature in it. The shortcut for which is "Fn + M".If you hit the combo of the keys Fn + M, all the above issues get resolved for a good amount of time. They reoccur with frequent use.There needs to be a major software update to resolve this.Ghosting of keys also occurs if you game using the num pad on the right side. I use a laptop so I'm assuming it may be because the laptop keyboard stays on along with this keyboard as well. It may be happening on Desktop as well.Buttons get dirty if you use it in moist/hot weather after some months. A lot of dirt gets collected in between the keys and the led sheet. Which is not possible to clean off without opening the keyboard.Button quality is still stable even though it's a coating of plastic. I assumed it would wear off overtime, but that is not the case.The led lights are helpful when using the keyboard in the dark.Although the programmable buttons do not share the led light. I do not understand why it was left out.Braided cable is an advantage since even after rough moves, it won't break.Above were the major points highlighted in the usage of this keyboard. I will give this a final rating of 4/5.Considering I was one of the first people to buy the keyboard when it launched and got it for a lesser price of 980rs. I am more than contended with the purchase.

Pros-1.It has smooth keys. Great for typing.2.It has 6 macro keys which is awesome.3.It looks nice.4.It has nice media buttons.5.Good for gaming.6.Tons of led light patterns.Cons-1.Personally im coming from an office keyboard so its a little hard to adjust to this as it has spaced out keys but that is just a personal problem im loving the keyboard.Overall- I would recommend it i got it for 1150/- and it was well worth it. The keys are neither too big or too small and its perfect. The cons are not game breaking and i would recommend getting this keyboard.I will update if i come across any issues.UPDATE : After 12 days of use I found that the right shift key gets jammed sometimes which is an inconvenience as i type fast. It shouldn't be an issue for anyone who doesn't use all 10 of their fingers.Changed rating from 5 to 4 stars.

This is one of the most underrated Keyboard at this price segment.I have been using this keyboard for a while now and let me tell you the pros and cons of this keyboard.‚Ä¢First Pros:1) This has a full RGB backlit setup which has 8 different modes which you can toggle between. These 8 modes are further customizable using the driver software.2) Dedicated Macro Keys. This is a really useful feature if you are into gaming or editing.( But there is a small short term con in this, will explain this below)3) Dedicated media Keys. I don't use this that often.. but it's a really useful feature to have.4) The typing experience is average. There is proper key travel.5) It has a dedicated driver software from which you can customise the functions of each and every individual keys, change the lighting effects and add macros to the keyboard.‚Ä¢Now for some cons:1) There is minor light bleeding through some keys (I will attach some pics). These are not easily noticeable but yeah.2) Sometimes if you press a key it does multiple entry( For eg:- if you are trying to type "Hello" it turns into "Hellllllllllllll" for that 2-3 second it does not take any other input) It happens really rarely But yeah it is annoying while gaming or typing.3) The body is really sturdy but the keys feel a little cheep.4) The short term con of the macro keys is that. At starting when you are gaming you might press the macro button instead of the Ctrl or Esc key. This won't happen ones you get used to the keyboard.Overall the Keyboard is really good. And I would really recommend it.Hope this was useful.

Great product. Slightly overpriced I would say by 200-300‚Çπ. Please cosmicbyte sitefor price before ordering.The keys are membrane I guys. Keys press are softs better for writing/programming.The rgb lighting is great and bright. Over-all build quality is acceptable for the pricing.The software is also good but it takes 2sec to update the changes, which is acceptable.The usb cable is also soft braided which is a plus.

This is a membrane keyboard which is soft to touch and kinda sloppy but for the price i think its ok.It supports 6 macro keys which can be edited via software.It also supports antighosting in 26 specific keys.(Specific keys are : Q, A, Z, W, S, X, E, D, C, B, R, F, V, T, G, M, "SPACE", "FOUR ARROW KEYS", TAB , "ALT-L", "CTRL-L", "SHIFT-L", CAPSLOCK.)The RGB is nice having 8 working modes and have 7 colours.You can turn on the backlight, change modes, increase/ decrease brightness, increase/ decrease the transition speeds via the keyboard shortcut keys.(The default colours can be changed via software).You can adjust the brightness and frequency of some modes via the keyboard shortcuts or from the software.RGB LED transition at very low speeds are kinda stuttering but at medium speeds its smooth.The software is not signed, hence windows may block the installation (if that happens click "learnmore" and then you'll see the installation button).Macro keys can be recorded fairly easy.Keyboard build quality is not that premium looking. The keys are aligned quite well for gaming.USB cables are braided and has a length of 1.8Meters.

I saw that it has a software and is full RGB. Let's buy this.So the product came. The logo was upside down. I did not want to change it immediately. Cause it did not bother me as much. This is a long term review and I am doing it since Amazon asked me. Bottom line is for the price it is one of the best "gaming" keyboards you can buy. I bought this keyboard around 2 months ago and it's still working fine with few minor or negligible problems.For detailed information keep readingFirst of all, the keys are not mechanical as they might seem. The actuation force is a bit high for a gaming keyboard, which means the keys need to be pressed a bit hard to register. Typing is fine, but could've been better since I've worked on more affordable keyboards and they type better. And also I would like to point out that the keys are painted and the paint is fading off (I've attached a picture, check it out). This has brought me down because now the keyboard looks cheap and shabby. I use the keyboard for gaming, so the keys I pressed the most are WASD, LShift, Ctrl, Space bar, and Tab. In one of the pictures that I attached, you can see 'A' and 'D' are already faded like they've been scrape out.Now the lighting effect. The lighting effects are good. There is quite a number of modes you can switch to (video attached). However, the keyboard is base lit and not key lit, which means the lights are not inside each key but is placed in the base of the keyboard and spread out throughout the keyboard. Key lit keyboards are better for readability in low light condition but you will not have a hard time using this keyboard in the same condition, either.Lastly, the build quality. The keyboard is completely made of plastic. Not too bad, but there is a lot of flex which makes it easy to break if you put some force to it. But I know you're not looking forward to put pressure on the keyboard with your dumbbells or any thing that's heavy, and since you're gonna be using it for gaming, the build quality should bother neither me nor you.Here's my verdict, for a thousand bucks you can't go wrong with this keyboard. It has decent keys, pretty good lighting effects, decent build quality, and oh I forgot to mention one more important thing, some of the keys have anti-ghosting feature which means if you press them all simultaneously, they will all register which is very important in gaming and you do not find this feature in conventional keyboards. This is a deal maker for me. However, I am not sure which all keys support this, but the keys I use most often which I mentioned above support anti-ghosting so I have no complaint and neither will you.

1st review (the day of the delivery)I'm going to be honest; I was kind of scared when I read the reviews because most of the people were giving negative and bad reviews about it.Those who gave negative reviews had one of these problems -1) Improper packaging and wrapping2) Bad handling by the delivery executive3) Damaged/removed keys4) Lighting options not working5) Broken base/ some of the keys not workingNow, if you're reading through the reviews and are about to move on to the next keyboard then wait and read this one.I'm going to talk about the keyboard in detail, including all the features, it's pros and cons.The first thing I did as I got the keyboard was to check every key if it's working correctly or not, and they all were (sigh of relief).First, the delivery and service :The order arrived two days early, thanks to the Amazon team. I bought the keyboard in a lightning deal (Rs. 880), which was even more reason to be scared because the lightning deals are infamous for delivering defected and used products. But mine looked good as new and felt terrific. I got the hang of it quickly.Second, the packaging :The packaging was intact and adequate. There was a cardboard covering on the outside and then the box of keyboard itself.Inside the box, the keyboard was covered and protected safely and adequately. So overall, the packaging was fine.Third, the feel and build quality :The keys are lifted, as mentioned in the description, and require less pressure to press them (it being a membrane keyboard and all). The keys do make a clickity sound, but it will not be even close to a mechanical keyboard sound, so don't keep your expectations too high.The build quality is where the keyboard loses points. The plastic used to make the keys and the body feels cheap and not premium at all.Also, talking about sturdiness, the keyboard is NOT as sturdy as mentioned in the description. It has a lot of flex in it, and the whole seems weak in terms of toughness and durability. But if you don't have a lot of traveling to do with the keyboard (in which the keyboard might break or something), then you don't have a lot to worry about since the keyboard will sit there with your system.The rubber feet under the keyboard hold it in place and it also has a kind of flippable stand under which can be used to lift the keyboard from behind.Fourth, the lighting modes :It has nine lighting modes that are bright enough to look cool even in daylight and the brightness can be changed.They can be changed by pressing Fn+(1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9). I will include images and videos for each lighting mode.You can change the speed of transitions by Fn+(-,+) and the level of brightness by Fn+(page up, page down).It has one unique feature, which I liked - the sound-sensitive lighting, which can be activated by Fn+9. It has a built-in microphone that picks up the sound in its surroundings, and the keyboard reacts accordingly. This effect looks really cool and is just amazing.Lastly, the multimedia keys :Fn+(F1-F12) Include - one media key (opens the music app), 3 volume keys (up, down and mute), 4 music control keys (play/pause, stop, previous and next), one button to open mail app, one home button (works differently depending on the app open), one lock key (locks the PC), and last calculator button.The description says that it has a 19-key rollover, which I tested and it IS true and they claim to be having 10M keypresses, so let's hope that turns out to be true as well.Overall the keyboard is a steal for Rs. 880, with the only drawback being the negligible sturdiness. If you want to buy a cheap RGB keyboard with lots of fun lighting modes, then go for it, it even has a one year warranty, so if anything goes wrong, you can always contact the manufacturer.Sorry if the review got a bit too long, but I was very confused when I wanted to buy it and I want to help others to clear out their doubts about this keyboard.This is a really early review and I will update it if I notice any changes in it.Peace ‚òÆThree months update-The keyboard is working fine. There are a few cons I discovered after the prolonged use.-It catches dust like a lot of it. So it requires cleaning the keys every week.-One of the letter (D) is starting to fade. The printing is not very good, and it's only after three months, so I'm guessing it's going to get much worse after this.Other than that, everything seems fine and the keyboard is working like it's supposed to. All the lighting modes are functioning well.

I did not buy this keyboard for gaming. I am a programmer and I have to write thousands of lines of codes at a go. Previously, I used the keypad of my laptop for typing but I wasn't feeling comfortable using the inbuilt keypad because I could not type very fast on the laptop as I always had a fear of jamming any key of the keypad. And you may know that replacing a laptop's keypad is very expensive. Hence, I decided to buy an external keyboard. While buying the keyboard, I considered mainly three points which were 1) the keyboard must have back-lit keys so that i can type in the night without turning the room lights on and disturbing others sleep,  2) the keyboard needed to be sturdy and 3) it must have adjustable height. At first, I decided to consider keyboards from reputed brands like Logitech but I realized that they were extremely expensive and would be an overkill for my needs. After that I came to know about this keyboard from CosmicByte. It had all the features which I had been looking for and luckily it wasn't expensive at all ! That's why I purchased this keyboard from Amazon at about 1.2k and after using it for some days, I must say it is quite good. I am listing down the pros and drawbacks of this keyboard below,> Pros1. It has 7 different LED colours and nine different modes ! You can even adjust the brightness of the LEDs and customize the illumination pattern. The LEDs are very bright and I can assure you that even reputed and expensive brands like HyperX, Corsair, Kingston do not have higher brightness than this one. Clearly, LED back-lighting is its biggest plus point.2. The height of the keyboard is adjustable and that's a good thing. It has four rubber pads on its back side to keep it firmly fixed on its place.3. The keys are scratch resistant.4. The cable is braided and super sturdy hence no chance of getting torn down due to folding.>Now, let's talk about its drawbacks,1. The keys are not that sturdy. It is still okay for typing but I seriously doubt about gaming. Although the keys look like mechanical ones but they aren't. if you are considering this keyboard for gaming then I would suggest you to avoid this.2. No dedicated media playback buttons.So the bottom-line is this is really a great, value for money keyboard if and only if you want super duper LED back lighting effect and comfortable typing for long sessions. However, this isn't a good gaming keyboard as the keys are not that sturdy and I seriously doubt how long it can last with heavy gaming.One last point, although this isn't about this keyboard. This is about packaging from Amazon. Amazon packed the product very poorly. They didn't wrap it with any bubble wrap or air pillows and shipped it directly within a plastic sack ! This type of poor packaging from Amazon is really a bad thing. I hope they improve their shipping standards.

This keyboard advertises 19 anti ghosting keys but it is just sweet talk to point towards the fact that not ALL keys work.For all you gamers out there, please note that that this keyboard will not register the W,Q and A keys together. Which basically means that you will NOT BE ABLE TO PEEK WHILE MOVING DIAGONALLY. Similarly, W, E and D will not be registered together. For a keyboard which advertises itself as a gaming keyboard with N-key rollover, this was a HUGE disappointment. Suggest you to spend a little more money and go for actual well-known vendors because cosmic-byte is only here to fool you all.

after a month of use i can say it's just awesome, too good.. key travel is more than my old intex one which is actually good, it is somewhat prone to catching dust under the keys, not too big of a deal since it's fairly easy to clean blowing air or using tweezers or removing the keys.. i would have liked a computer sleep hotkey but no big deal, can still use the windows shortcuts but they are like 4 key presses.. windows+D then alt+f4 then arrow up then enter.. love the lighting and control options.. it doesn't remember the light settings once the computer is turned back on that might be good actually.. takes anywhere from 1 to few keystrokes to get to the desired setting. this is in no way a mechanical keyboard but it's far better than the membrane keyboards we typically use.. sits somewhere in the middle.. spillproof too, there are 3 water drain holes at the bottom, you can see right through them. i didn't have any issues with the key prints fading off yet and it feels like the paint layer is substantial when i touch trying to feel how thick the paint is, quiet thick i would say.. having said all this, it still gets no less than 5 stars from me.. there is no other keyboard even close to the price with backlit rgb and this many lighting options that looks so dam cool.. nothing beats it.. I'd say go for it!

this is just an attempt to find out what typing on this thing feels like.The tactile feedback is pretty good, however the end is a bit soft. So it's good-bad.The overall feel of typing is pretty good though.The keys aren't too hard to press, they are spaced well enough.The shape of the enter key is a bit different from what I'm habituated to, but that's not an issue.The backlighting is pretty good. It comes with a direct on-off switch, and has 3 levels of intensity adjustment.Note: this is a blue LED only model. The direct LED on-off key is very handy instead of having to toggle through the settings.The risers on the bottom aren't too tall, so they don't give the keyboard much of an angle.Overall, it's a very good keyboard, but not one particularly aimed at gamers.It's essentially just a normal keyboard with some backlit keys.

Sleek. Lightweight. Bang for buck.No one would argue on the fact that Logitech products have degraded their quality in last decade and they do not last as long as they used to, the usability their products provide for the cost we as a consumer pay are still unbeatable.This keyboard (which comes with a mouse) have smooth and soft to press switches, which would get rougher eventually as dust settles in it.I had logitech K120 previously. A couple of switches went out after few years of use. Knowing the fact that logitech is not as reliable as it used to be, I doubt it would last "5 Million keystrokes" as it suggests on the packaging.It feels easy to type though I would have loved a bigger "Enter" key rather than a slim key.  Space key is huge and more than comfortable to continually press it with thumb. The keys have different sounds which is a nice engineering touch. Overall, Good keyboard for the money.Mouse on the other hand felt on the cheaper side. Clicks are way to soft. Scrolling has sufficient and good feedback but the clicks feel a little too softer than it should. I've had multiple cheaper mouse of some random companies that felt more ergonomic, comfortable and good to click.Thats just my honest opinion. Overall, a good combo for the price of 799 Indian rupees for daily use. I would not recommend it for gaming. Choose a good mechanical keyboard for gaming instead of this.

Best for beginners and its value for money!Couldn't ask for a better graphic tablet for this price range.Pros:1. Have a large(not the biggest)  surface area, i can assure you that you will not have shortage of drawing area.2.Comes with 8 extra nibs(not that you actually need them alot, one could last for months)3. Installations and Driver download are very easy. (just go to Huion official website and click driver, search the model and you are done)4.8000+ pressure sensitivity,from fine line to brick size brush, you have them all.5.Compitible with most drawing software from free to paid. (i have tried using it on krita, PS, autodesk sketchbook. It works like butter)6.Tilt recognition: it will depend on the software you use as not all support one. Its handy in sketching.7.A cool looking tablet. Even if you dont draw, you can just place it as a furniture and mesmerise your guests. Lol8.Budget friendly. I bought it at 5300 INR. Gosh i was lucky with the sale.9.The tablet has a matt like sureface, its smooth but have ample amount of friction to draw on10.I could go on. But you get the point.Cons:1. Gloves and surface cleaner cloth not included. Not that i was expecting.2.The pen holder could  have been havier. A little pressure could make it fall.3.I have used it for only one months and i can not say anything about the durability. (quick fact: You could kill a lion with a wacom tablet and still work fine,but this huion tablet feels like it will not survive the night if you dont handle with care. )Dont worry as there are no complaints yet from other customers worldwide about its durability.4.The double click seems to fail sometime(of the button on the pen). You can get used to it.5.There is no touch feature,most wacom tablets have one. Its another point to be noted. Which means you cannot use your hand gesture like pinch in for zoom in and pinch out for zoom out.NOTE: i will give another review after using for a year. Peace out

I'm not an artist and I mostly use it to edit photos/videos and sculpt in Blender. I upgraded from the one by wacom as nibs were impossible to find in India.I can definitely say that it feels excellent. It has great tracking and pressure sensitivity. Tilt is a bit hit or miss in my experience.  But I don't really use it anyway so not a big deal for me. It also may have been user error on my end.The only thing that bothered me is that the pen doesn't support click and drag. So you can't press one button on the pen and then drag the pen to scroll/zoom etc. Also the surface is prone to scratches and it's a fingerprint magnet. That's really a bummer but not a deal breaker.Overall highly recommended.

This tablet is really nice to work with! The pen moves smoothly across the surface and doesn't make much noise at all. The design of the tablet is also very space economic--it doesn't take up more space on your desk than it has to. My last tablet took up more space even though it's surface area was smaller!Installing the drivers was easy, although at first it seemed to not click properly so I uninstalled and reinstalled it and now it works great.I feel like I notice the high pen pressure levels in that it makes lines very smooth and extremely controlled.I would for sure recommend this to any digital artist. It's a lovely size, works smoothly, and feels like great quality. I love the battery-free pen too.

I have been using Huion H 950 P for over a month. Not only it looks great, it also is quite a responsive piece of hardware. But despite all the the facilities it has brought to my video editing and image editing experience, I cannot claim it to be the most professional thing in the market. I have several complaints with this Tab. the first being the driver software. Despite several efforts, I could not update it. It has some very weird interface in the form of mouse mode and Ink mode. if I choose ink mode for the pen button, selecting the text becomes very very difficult and if I choose Mouse mode then all the texts are getting selected at the slightest touch of the pen and scrolling the page becomes a nightmare. I had to opt for both the ink mode and mouse mode. But then it is not responding well while I am using Premiere Pro. Then once again I had to revert back to the mouse mode to have a smooth experience in video editing. So far I had to switch between the modes several times for different applications. And the switches on the left hand side are the worst part of this tablet none of whom works smoothly, sometimes I had to press the switches more than one time to make them perform the assigned tasks.My overall assessment is that - it might be a good pen tablet for the beginners, but the professionals and the semi professionals would not like it much. I will continue to use it, because I cannot afford another tablet at this point of time. I will recommend it only for the price point at which it is providing a medium size tablet with functioning buttons. But anyone who want to do some serious stuffs, must consider shelling out big bucks which will stand them in good stead in the long run.

Have been using the HUION H950p for about 2 weeks. The tablet is lightweight and thin, yet so sturdy. The workspace is just big enough for a beginner myself. Although you will want to adjust the pressure sensitivity of the pen (Just YouTube how) to your comfort and this process is common for all tablets. The driver installation as well as warranty registration wasn't that hard.You have 6 customizable keys. The keys are not wobbly. I did notice the left side of the keys are softer to press than their right. I prefer left side more. Now, coming to the surface texture, it feels like any tablet  when touching with your hand. But, using the pen it feels like writing on paper placed on a writing pad. For me, I like the feel.The pen body isn't too big and has a good grip. Comes with tilt support(Which I have used only for testing). It fits without a wobble into the pen holder(The holder has 8 extra nibs). It says a nib last for months.Yes, It's supported by majority of the software. But, I do advise you... When you first get a drawing software, do configure the pen settings!! Krita had some pen pressure issue, the pen strokes were horribly light. But, after watching YouTube tutorials and adjusting Krita. It was good as new.I'd recommend buying this as a beginner. Personally the hand and eye coordination stuff ain't difficult. If you wanna go for animation, online teaching, digital art and so on. This is more than enough and worth investing. (I bought this at Rs. 4100)

I'm editing my review here:So I have contracted many associates in Amazon to check this product they gave me was new or not...finally my issue has been solved...So the thing is when I received my product, the box was damaged so I thought they gave me an old product. Best for beginnersPros:-Good pressure sensitivityLight weight penPen glides over tab surface but u won't get a pen on paper feelAndorid support &  no extra software neededPen stand with 8 extra nibsShortcut keysEasy to install driversConsNo Bluetooth supportNote :-For samsung users the cursor won't display in most phones,  in such case u can download huion sketch app which has cursor optionPlz don't go for xp pen deco its not good at allIf u want a much better experience with touch support then go for wacom Intuos pro models but it's price is high

I have intuos small, xp pen deco pro and an I pad air.  I use graphic tablet generally for animation and photoshop and sometimes on my Android smartphone.Build quality :Huion has overall good build quality it's not upto wacom standard but it's good it's certainly quite thin and stylish.Writting experience : Writting experience was great it wad better than my Wacom intuos small or xp pen. It was neither super smooth nor super rough it was just perfect.Comparison with wacom in similar price segment: At similar price segment Wacom has few products to compete, but still huion drawing impression was quite great overall it was a bit better than intuos. The only thing it's lacking is a universal driver like wacom.Comparison with XP Pen Deco series: Deco series is great not gonna lie but still for the similar price range I found huion to be great it has better surface feel, better drawing experience less wabble, almost no smoothing effect and more frequent driver updates.Short and simple answer :1) If you're a beginner or intermediate and are in learning stage than this is the perfect choice.2) If you're an advanced person using different pens and tablets at different times amd are making money from your work you might go for Wacom.3) If you're willing to buy an XP Pen then I would suggest not to because specially in country like India Huion providing the best drawing experience at minimal cost also Huion has only a few models in this prive range and they're genuinely getting frequent updates, unlike XP Pen that have thousands of models on same peice range and even a bit overpriced but still not giving frequent updates and bug fixes.So if you wanna start out this is the way to go.

Firstly, this review is not for customer, it is meant for manufacture and seller, too. Secondly,I am using a laptop keyboard skin/cover from last 8 years. The first question is why we use a keyboard skin. As a user, we do not want dust go to keyboard. This particular skin cover is too fit to the keyboard (Thinkpad 14 inch). It still leaves outer edge of the keyboard. Henceforth, some dust will go to keyboard automatically. Further, we won‚Äôt get 100 percent protection from dust, water, etc.Therefore, I request to manufacture that please increase to size of keyboard skin/cover, so that, it can completely cover the keyboard.

I have already bought Saco transparent cover for my 3 year old laptop and just loved it for its softness and light weight.Now I wanted another cover for my newer laptop and decided to buy the "BLACK" version - BIG MISTAKE! The black cover COMPLETELY blocks the keyboard's backlight. You won't be able to see the which key is which, you just have light emitting from the key borders. Hence the laptop's backlight feature is rendered useless by the black version.Oh and you CAN'T return this item, Amazon only allows replacement, they will send exactly the same model as a replacement. So make sure you buy the TRANSPARENT version for your backlit keyboard.

It looks good, and doesn't mess with the look of the laptop unlike older skins that would look ugly when applied. It's easy to install, as in you just place it over the keyboard and it pretty much fits like a glove.That makes it great for dust protection, but I'm not sure it will be spill proof, especially if the spill happens around the edges, because it's not sealed completely at the edges. When you type or when you look at it from the side, there are tiny gapsbthat appear to be present which is enough for a liquid to get through. It's like an umbrella. Your head remains dry because it's directly under it, but your shoulders/back are gonna get slightly wet.I basically need it for dust protection, so I'm all good, but whoever is buying for spill protection need to keep this in mind.

A bit heavy keyboard, because of the aluminium body. 13 backlight patterns. Awesome to use while gaming. Wrist resting plate provides comfort. Compared to Redgear and other same range keyboards its stands out a bit with some extra features. If anyone looking for the 1st gaming mechanical keyboard, close your eyes and go with this product. Given it 5star as i was looking to cut a star but it haven't given a single chance to do that... Thumbs up from me.

In the beginning I was unsure if this was a good purchase, but after typing on in for a long period of time and gaming I realized my wrists or my hands weren't paining as they usually do. It takes time to get adjusted to the caps and shift buttons though (Important for Moba gamers and csgo players) but overall this Keyboard fairs well with good feedback little heavy but if you've been using a membrane keyboard you'll probably just ignore it and its easy to clean the keys them selves don't catch any dust or sticky dirt but the aluminum plate will. A small soft brush should do the trick to keep it clean. Just a reminder go on their official website and sign up for an extended warranty of another year giving you 2 yrs of a warranty period. Have a nice day :)
Great Mechanical Keyboard for budget.And the JIXIAN Blue switches are just awesome.

Good budget mechanical gaming keyboard. The switches are a chinese version of the cheery mx brown keys. Not too bad to be honest. Good tactile response and silent as compared to blue switches. Absolutely ideal for day to day usage and occasional gaming.Overall satisfied with the purchase. My only gripe is the red colored wrist rest/hand rest. It doesn't look bad but a black colored one would've been better.Will update review after long term usage.

I bought this keyboard in July 2019. It has 1-year warranty provided by the manufacturer. The keyboard itself is very good, the lights are bright and feels good to type on.  But keys stopped working after 1 year.I suggest getting a non Mechanical keyboard from a good brand like corsair. Or get the cheapest but proper mechanical keyboard from Gigabyte that costs around the same money as this one, it won't have RGB or any backlight but they are good reliable keyboards that come with 3 years of warranty.

i will never buy cosmic byte products , their terms and conditions are not user friendly. their returns policy is most worst, product  quality is weak.Pros :-Keys are very , have good feedback.lot of RGB options.COns:-big in sizekeys makes lot of noisekeyboard build is not sturdy and very fragile to use.the metal cover where are keys are placed is thin sheet of aluminum very cheap and easier to get dents. (as per policy you cannot get replacement for genuine problem if its dented)if you see pics uploaded RDB stopped working for few keys after infrequent use of just 6 months.there was no keyboard replacement as stock was not available. below are some  terms and condition you need to read before purchasing.Kindly note -  The product needs to be properly packed ensuring the product is intact and shouldn't get damaged during transit.Cosmic byte will not be liable in case of any damage caused to the product in transit.Upon receiving the product, if the service team does not find any issue with the product, the return courier charges will have to be borne by the customer.Warranty will be void if the product is any physically damaged, caused by neglect, misuse, abuse, and unauthorized modifications that are done on the product.

I bought this keyboard about 7 months ago. It was a great keyboard until the point when my main key for gaming, "W" key suddenly stopped working. I really love this keyboard. They replaced my unit with a new one as it was within the warranty period. If you want a blue switch mechanical gaming keyboard at an affordable price, this is the go-to choice!

All I can say is this feels very good in terms of Price, Quality & Experience. Good work to Cosmic Bytes.generally outemu, kailh are good products. Kailh is a bit superior & close to Cherry MX. Beside being cheap they deliver good experience. I've used a few for years.Their blue switches are very clicky.But this brown swtich pretty quiet. I think this is linear with no tactile feedback. And it's really amazing, my typing speed have improved by atleast 5 wpm within a day.Large keys like space bar, backspace, shift & enter make some spring noise, which is quite normal, but considering the silence of other keys, they are a bit disturbing.Other than that this keyboard won't disappoint any mech switch lovers.

Does have some issues but overall for this price it's pretty good.Only cons:Keys stroke sound is inconsistent with some keys and the feel is even more inconsistent. Pressing the key like "w" for prolongated period of time broke the key, now the mechanical click isn't clicky enough as the other keys.But overall. I love it.

Pros:1. Value for Money.2. Keys feels very sturdy.3. Brown switches makes less sound than the blue ones.4. Multiple lighting mode, specially the gaming mode lighting is best while you play games. Also, there is a Gaming mode where you can modify the lights in the switches for specific games when needed.5. Build quality is more than satisfying in regards with the price point.6. There are three levels of brightness.7. Wrist rest in a good add-on.Cons:1. Wrist rest is not much comfortable, but again, the price matters and its good for me.

I Purchased Cosmic Byte CB Gk11(Outemu Brown) in the deal.My First Impression...... My Opinions* The Packaging was great no tear/damage.* Manufactured and Imported in Dec20.* It came with a wrist pad & a Key remover tool.* It felt quiet sturdy and durable.* It also looked semi premium as compared to others brands in the market.* Cable Quality was also good in the price range.* RGB effects are amazing never seen this type of RGB effects.**The Feedback was Above Average. But in this price it's great.***The Price of this Keyboard was shockingly amazing.......2.2k.These are my first 3 days impressions.If you want a great RGB Gaming mechanical keyboard with a wrist pad under 2.5k. I blindly suggesting you to buy this one.But Before Buying this Please Check the Switches that you want. I prefer Brown switches because these are silent/linear as compared to blue switches.

INITIAL REACTION: This is the best product you can get in this price bracket, very good but little bit noisy switched but it is responsive and very very easy to use and hand rest will not hamper long usage as it sturdy and well built.Edit: it's been 16 month since I'm using this keyboard and it required RMA in 8th month due to ghosting keys and now again started to stop working on few keys for sometimes and work smoothly later so I think it's life span is nearing to the end and it served me well but this is why people spend more money on pricey Keyboard because they last long.My initial reaction was amazing but I went through difficult RMA process which wasn't easy as I had to courier it to Bangalore to get it replaced and it was not delievery at home but I had to visit courier office to collect it. If you do want to spend too much then go for it but it won't last long as you expect.

There is a thing with the keys.... eg: key 1 has 2 symbols... '1' and '!'. So the lights are placed in such a way that only '!' symbol get illuminated properly... and '1' symbol gets less illumination... and its problem all keys that have 2 symbols... the top symbol illuminates correctly... but the bottom one hardly gets any light...(shown in image)nitpick: the wrist rest is difficult to attach as no instructions are given and I had to search a video on how to do that...Keyboard looks good with good brightness at max level(esp. Red key... its bright enough to like the color) the click are there...Also, the space key and enter key has different feel and sound to it while typing...(not sure if intended or bad design)... but this is my first Mechanical keyboard and excited to use it :DAlso, giving it 3 stars coz it arrived late(didn't dispatched for a whole week and dispatched at the date it was supposed to arrive)...Also, DON'T THROW AWAY THE MANUAL... The key combinations are given on that and there is no software for color coding keys...And the in-built pre game modes are sh*t... but some combinations are good and tou can color code your keyboard however you like

Bought this keyboard in January 2019 and it worked flawlessly for about 15 months. Then problems began with keys not working and even after a thorough but gentle cleaning with compressed air after removing all the keys, several keys are not working. In addition, the illumination for some keys has failed.At this time, the 'w' key isn't working at all and several other keys have a mind of their own, they come and go as they please. I'm having to paste the letter 'w' from the clipboard each time!Dust is the likely reason for the keys failing and I do keep the keyboard covered most of the time when not in use. It perhaps extended the life a little.At this rather high price point, it simply isn't recommended.

The build quality is just okay. I don't know why I feel like the reviews are exaggerated. On an other note if you come from a cooler master keyboard, you'll find this keyboard pretty cheaply built. The keys are okay but too loud. I'd suggest the brown one. The keycaps look really really cheap with the matt black finish.

This is my very first mechanical keyboard. I have bought the blue switch version of this keyboard and the experience is just superb. The feel, click sounds take it to next level. The lighting is per key RGB, which I don't think that there is any keyboard that offers this feature at this price point. There are static RGB effect and some preset patterns and also the lights can be turned off. Although there is no software to change the lighting effect, it can be changed in the keyboard itself. I live closer to coastal region, so the USB ports in my PC tend to rust due to this weather; The gold plated USB connector comes very handy. I will update on the durability of the keyboard after some months of usage. Overall a nice and satisfactory purchase. I regret that I did not purchase this keyboard earlier.

(Note: I'm a hardcore gamer, not a casual gamer, so these points, though they seem silly, are very important for my gaming).I have these primary problems:Keyboard:1. Key rollover doesn't work for Numpad keys. When I press Up-Arrow, Left-Arrow and Numpad-0 keys simultaneously, the Numpad-0 functionality doesn't work. This is a deal-breaker for gamers who don't use WASD, and still use the old Arrow keys for movement. Come on RedGear, even the basic Logitech K270 keyboard handles this properly, even though that is not a gaming keyboard.2. The Numpad/Caps Lock/Windows Lock lights are ridiculously bright, and for some reason are angled to hit you directly under your eyes. Why?? There is a white coating on that LED cover, facing away from the user, covering the LED up completely would have been much easier on the eyes.3. The keys are raised far too high. Again, probably a problem only for the Arrrow-key users, you will by mistake press the Ledt-Arrow while pressing the Up-Arrow.Mouse:The mouse is uncomfortable (maybe it's just me), my hand is hurting, something that many other mice have not done.Headphone:The headphone (as others have mentioned) isn't great at bass, but if I increase the volume to double the usual level I set it to, it seems fine. The over-head band however, is way too tight (there are two bands, the lower band is the problem). I had a headache the first day I used it, seems to be getting better the more my head is getting used to it.I really wanted to like this product, given the good ratings, but sadly, some of us will be better off using a basic Logitech keyboard/mouse, rather than this supposedly 'gaming' gear. The fact that this is a budget gaming gear is very evident.To make matters worse, apparently, I can't return this, I can only get this exchanged. That's 2.5k gone down the drain.
The headphones have stopped working in 10 days, how can i claim warrenty.

This is a combo of redgear blaze gaming keyboard (tournament edition they say), and redgear Manta mt21 gaming mouse. Both the peripherals are RGB however RGB can't be synced, keyboard is a membrane one and not the mechanical one however it just feels like the mechanical one because the keys are so soft with clicking sound and that is good to any one's liking. Mouse Comes with 6 buttons excluding the mouse wheel (Right Mouse button, Left Mouse button, two dpi button and two programmable buttons on left side), it's DPI is maximum 3200.Now talking about RGB thing, on keyboard you got two options either you can switch to any of the three colours(red, blue, pink) or you can switch to breathing effect which changes colours automatically. Coming on the mouse it has four colours (blue, pink, red, purple) although it comes with a software to program it's buttons but there is no need of it because the default buttons just does the job, but again if you want to program any button you got the software. And not only the keyboard and Mouse combo Looks good but also, they feel to be pretty sturdy, the cables are braided one on both, and body of keyboard is made up of aluminium metal, mouse also feels to be sturdy.Conclusion :- Highly Recommend, when the price is ‚Çπ1500, since the price of this combo changes a lot therefore it is recommended to wait for about 1week and as the price is 1500 just grab it, since it rarely goes below it. If you are using a normal keyboard and mouse then as soon as you switch to this you will surely be going to be impressed by it.Also if anything unexpected happens to any of the peripheral I will be updating the review.Thank you.

Redgear usually makes good products at affordable prices. I was greatly disappointed to find this keyboard defective. Please ensure that all your keys are working properly so you can return the product if required.I purchased this as a gift so it remained unopened for a couple of weeks. On connecting this keyboard to our PC we discovered that the left shift and left CTRL keys were NOT WORKING! I tried updating drivers, unchecking sticky keys, using different ports on my PC - nothing worked. We had to reconnect our old hp keyboard in order to use our PC.One very frustrating thing about this 'gaming mouse' is that all of your settings are LOST on shut down. You have to relaunch the mouse application every time and 'apply' the settings in order to get your shortcut keys working as intended.Conclusion: Disappointing product by Redgear. Does not meet my expectations.Keyboard - defective (two keys not working), however the lights look pretty cool.Mouse - frustrating and impractical; settings need to be manually applied every time you start your PC

When I was purchasing this and read reviews there was some very good and some very bas reviews. I thought how can same product have such opposing experiences.Then when I ordered I realised. On first order various keyboard buttons were not working and all other things like mouse, mouse pad and headset were perfect. But when I replaced the order I got keyboard working fine but headset sound quality was very bad on this one. Then I realised why some people were saying headset is just ok or bad and some were saying it is good. Then instead of replacing it again I just swapped the old heaset with the new one and got whole combo working perfectly fine. My headset is great. It is even better than my Philips SHP1900 that I got for Rs. 500.So everyone check all the items in combo if they are good, if not then replace them.1 less star because of the hassle I have to go through. Don't know if it is fault of seller or Amazon or the manufacturing company. Mostly it is manufacturing company's fault. They should make same product with same quality.By the way I am using this combo for 5 months now and it is working perfectly good.

Despite me loving this set, I just wished the mouse DPI was as described.  It reaches minimum 1200DPI. I bought this because I wanted a lower dpi mouse and this set had described it as having an 800 dpi mouse.My old cosmic byte had 1200dpi hence I needed something less.Anyway, the keyboard is perfect to type, to game on, feels like mechanical though it isn't. RGB is spot on on all the peripherals.Mouse is a little slippery for my liking, but it'll get to me in time.The headphones could have used a little bass, just a little, because sounds can get a little irritating (sharp) at times. Directional audio is good, but sometimes it might confuse you how far the enemy / object is.By far the most comfortable gaming headphone I owned.Long gaming/music sessions, no problemo!Mic is on point. One might wonder if it'll catch audio since it's right up the left headphone cup, but it surprisingly does!Overall, a really good product.Durability will have to be tested in due time.Everything else is spot on.

Timely delivery of the product. Looks extremely nice. Had a few friends drooling over it. The quality of the mouse is great. Feels sturdy to operate and looks like it will last. The cables are also of exceptional quality and covered in a threaded enclosure. The keyboard is great to look at, especially with the red background light. However, the keys are a bit flimsy and do not seem that it would last longer. However, it is adequate at the price it was available on Amazon. Satisfied with the purchase.

In defence of the RedGear Keyboard.There are some problems with the keyboard, but for the price point this is totally appropriate.There are only 3 RGB colours ‚Äì red, pink and blue. The LED lighting is not very bright.And yes, the keys are not actually visible from any other typing angle apart from straight down. In all other scenarios, you will have to raise the keyboard at a 90 degrees, in order to find the key you need to press.That being said, the keys are definitely very clicky. The built of the keyboard looks super sturdy. The borders are fully metallic, enough to leave scratches on the table if not handled properly. The keys give a proper feedback on being pressed. As a touch typist, there is simply a joy in pressing this keyboard. I‚Äôm having fun just typing the review itself.As for the reviews stating the presence of phantom spaces and what not, I cannot agree, the keyboard works properly as it is supposed to. I do not know how long it will last but it definitely gives the impression of lasting a long time.The mouse, on the other hand, is actually a step above the keyboard. This is possibly the most sturdy mouse I have used so far. Logitechs and dells have failed me before quite often, that too heavy duty gaming mice. But so far the RedGear mouse stands strong. The LEDs are not bright, for sure, and the extra buttons on the mouse are not the best quality. But they give a good feedback on being pressed. The wheel is still working properly after rigorous use, including the middle button press and scrolling. No phantom scrolls nothing. The mouse is working satisfactorily.So all in all, a good purchase.

Mouse works exactly bas mentioned about it.Keyboard in my case has a bit issues on the num section as numbers 5 & 9 on single click dials more than onceExample - hit 9 once and it shows 999 or 9999 you have to like touch it slowly and same goes with 5.I have used it for gaming and the sounds makes perfect.Lights - mild for blue but a little bright for purple and red in dark.

The Redgear keyboard mouse combo is a good option at this price, it looks and feels like a nice gaming keyboard. Sensitivity of the mouse is perfect for gaming and there are dedicated keys to adjust sensitivity while in work. Mouse feels premium and fits right perfect in palm. Definetely no complaints for mouse.All in all its a great combo and serves the purpose. If you're getting into gaming then its a right combo to start with.

This wired keyboard mouse combo is amazing for gamers. Absolutely one of the best in the market and much better than most others. I am using this as the primary gaming keyboard/mouse in a rig I hooked up for my kids. It was long overdue. Keys have a wonderful feel. The travel distance of the keys is more than most normal keyboards so you feel the movement when playing. The mouse is solid and feels tough and hardcore. The red backlight is not intimidatingly bright but is enough to see the keys if room lighting is low. The mouse goes through the rainbow of color changes every 20 seconds or so. Great products.I am using a Asus TUF Gaming X570-PLUS motherboard with a AMD Ryzen-5 3600 MHz 6-Core processor with a Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB DDR4 3200MHz RAM. My graphics card is ASUS Radeon RX 580 8GB Dual-Fan OC Edition GDDR5. The PSU is Corsair RM650. I'm using two hard disks in this. The booting is a Western Digital WD Blue SSD 250 GB SATA III and the bulk storage is a standard 1 TB Seagate Baracuda as the secondary. All this is housed in a Corsair Carbide Series CC-9011050-WW cabinet. I'm using Samsung 27 inch Curved LED Backlit Computer Monitor and a Redgear Pro Series Wired Gamepad. The keyboard mouse combo is this Redgear Manta MT21 Gaming Keyboard. The sound is from F&D F-203G 2.1 Channel Multimedia Speakers System. Everything is bought here on Amazon within days of each other and it is perfectly matched.I recommend this keyboard/mouse and whole matched setup to anyone interested in building a top-of-the-line gaming computer that will not be outdated anytime soon.Highly recommended.
